results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014
--------------------------------------------------------------------


Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation Energize your body Strenthen your mind Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 7:30 PM – 9:00 PM

 Day: Mondays 

Where: Room #102,

 Freeport Recreation Center 

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520 

Contact: Nan, [masked],[masked]
results.name: Bodhi Meditation - Freeport Long Island

* Increase self-awareness

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Contact: Nan, [masked],[masked]

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card.  The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

 -------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

• Description :Let's meet and have a great time dancing in One of NYC's Top Dance Parties as featured in Timeout New York Magazine, celebrating their 6th year @ Taj Lounge!
Great dinner and dancing experience, live music, performers and guest DJ's. 

• RSVP: To enjoy the reduced admission , Mention the code that you will see in the comment section, it is different every week !!

• Price: $10 if you RSVP on the meet up. 

• Time:  8 pm- 2am ( Salsa Lesson at 7.00pm)


• Address: Taj Lounge, 48 W 21st St, New York

• What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

• Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.
results.name: Salsa dancing with Salsa New York @ Taj Lounge: Live Music + Performances

results.description:
*************************************************************

HACKERNEST NYC ONE YEAR ANNIVERSARY EXTRAVAGANZA!

*************************************************************


HackerNest Tech Socials are a fun, relaxed way to connect with your local tech brethren. All you have to do is show up, grab a nametag, find a beer, and hang out! Best of all, it's free.

This month marks the one year anniversary of the first HackerNest event in NYC. In the last 12 months we've grown to 3000 members, hosted 10 meetups, drank about 2400 beers, and made countless new friends. Since we'll be taking December off for the holidays, let's close out the year with a bang!

In addition to the HackerNest regulars (free beer & wine), we'll also have some fun social activities to help set the mood:

• CORNHOLE! (I'm told this is a very American thing)


• VIDEOGAMES! (This is a nerdy thing)


• COMMUNITY! (Share your favourite Meetups around the city)


• FRIENDS!


• SYNERGY!

So bring your friends, classmates, and co-workers, it's gonna be a blast. Let's celebrate 2015 and get ready for an awesome HackerNest schedule in 2016!

For more info on HackerNest in general: 
HackerNest FAQ | HackerNest Twitter | HackerNest Facebook

Attendees:

That's you! Thanks for coming. Attendance is free, so all you need to do is be friendly and welcoming. We expect everyone to respect the HackerNest "No Douchebag" policy, which includes everything on the JSConf Code of Conduct, but also includes other forms of harassment like soliciting business or aggressively recruiting. Events like ours rely on everyone being great, so if you see someone being less than awesome, let us know, and they can take it elsewhere :)

Sponsors:

OVH: Worldwide hosting provider

OVH is hiring! Join the dynamic team at world's third biggest internet hosting provider. Apply now if you're looking for innovation, challenge and a great team spirit! 

Sponsors make this growing movement possible, so we treasure and build deep, long-term relationships with the companies that endorse us. If you are the real deal and want to connect with the NYC tech community, let us know.

Become a HackerNestNYC Sponsor

Venue:

Work-bench: Enterprise Technology VC Fund (and workspace!)

Work-bench hosts some of the best enterprise meetups in the city and is an awesome space for us to hangout!

Wanna show off your office? We're always looking for big open spaces with 200+ (standing room) capacity that are easily accessible. Email us! 

Host a HackerNestNYC Event



Volunteers: 

Every city has a small team of volunteers that makes HackerNest possible. Usually, this just involves moving furniture, putting beer on ice, serving drinks, etc., and we will never let it take over your whole night. So if you can spare some time to pitch in and help out, please do!

Become a HackerNestNYC Volunteer
results.how_to_find_us: Enter off of 5th avenue, then take the elevator to the fifth floor
results.name: HackerNest NYC November Tech Social

results.description:
This will be the official intermediate Korean class. The class material will be provided. We will go through grammars, vocabularies, speaking, and practice with fun activities. - For members who has taken beginner plus classes can continue here.

If you know how to read & write Korean letters(Hangul) you can join the class. What we cover for the class is tense, verb conjugation with practical phrases.

Since I need to book a space ahead, please consider your RSVP seriously and let me know if you can't make it after you said YES to come.

The location will be either near Bryant park. The exact location will be sent to members privately. Please, email me at [masked] with your contact number if you can come. I will send mine so we can communicate better when the meet up happens.

The class fee will be $15 per person. Once you commit for 4 weeks series of classes it will be $40. Please, note you won't get a credit if you cancel your attendance on the same day. Be prepared for the class! :)

We may hang out and mingle after the class. I'm very excited to see you all and look forward to it! 
If you have any questions,please leave a comment.
results.how_to_find_us: Email me at MyKoreanLessonTutor@gmail.com
results.name: Korean- Intermediate

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)
results.name: Monday 8:15pm Tron Ball - Night Soccer @ LIC (7v7 game) for PS2G

results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

The BNI Dream Team. 

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

BNI Dream Team is currently looking for these professions to pass a boat load of business to. 

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Florist, Photographer, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, October 20th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

Plenty of Parking, trains: M & R, Grand Ave station

The cost is $15 which includes breakfast.

Please bring 30 business cards to pass out.

STOP LETTING BUSINESS PASS YOU BY AND TAKE ACTION NOW!
results.name: IF BUSINESS IS PASSING YOU BY, YOU SHOULD COME TO OUR BNI

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

results.description:
We're running a fun trip to Costa Rica over Thanksgiving time!  If you're interested please send me (Jon) a message for a more complete itinerary (with all the activities fully explained) or if you have any questions.


Dates: 

Tuesday, November 24, 2015 - Sunday, November 29, 2015 (only 2 vacation days needed!)

Quick summary:

• 2 days  / 2 nights in Monteverde 

• 3 days / 3 nights in Manuel Antonio 


What's included:

• 5 breakfasts, 3 lunches, 2 dinners 

• 3* hotels (3 nights), private 6 bedroom house in Monteverde (2 nights) - double occupancy 

• Zip lining (Monteverde) 

• Cloud Forest Reserve tour/exploration (Monteverde) 

• Manuel Antonio National Park tour 

• Catamaran cruise (Manuel Antonio area) 

• Good people from NYC :)

Price: 

• $899

Itinerary:

• Day 1: Relax in our ridiculously large private 6 bedroom house that's literally in the cloud forest reserve.  The pictures are ridiculous!  Meals: Breakfast, dinner.  Overnight: Monteverde (private house) 

• Day 2: Zip lining!  Then Cloud Forest Reserve tour/exploration.  Meals: Breakfast, lunch.  Overnight: Monteverde (private house) 

• Day 3: Drive from Monteverde to Manuel Antonio.  Relax at the beach!  Meals: Breakfast 

• Day 4: Manuel Antonio National Park exploration and relaxation!  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch.  Overnight: Manuel Antonio 

• Day 5: Catamaran cruise!  Swimming, snorkeling, beach, boat.  Meals: Breakfast, lunch, dinner.  Overnight: Manuel Antonio 

• Day 6: Drive from Manuel Antonio to San Jose for flight back to JFK.  

Notes

• You must live in NYC to attend this trip 

• Flight is not included.  However, it's very cheap to fly internationally from the U.S. during this time.  You can get direct, non-stop flights (NYC to/from San Jose) for around $550 (as of first week in October).


Message me if you want to come!

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
Branding a is tool that allows you as a small business owner, entrepreneur or creative professional to tell your story through the use of color, font, design and emotion. The question you need to ask yourself is, "How will you use these tools to develop and maintain your brand identity?"

At this event you will hear from branding experts Zeshan Malik and Ramon Ray, on what it takes to create a thoughtful, fully developed brand that will tell your story.

During this event you will also have time to network and build relationships with other entrepreneurs while enjoying delicious coffee and breakfast provided by Seven Grams Caffe. 

About the Expert:

ZeShan Malik is a New York based entrepreneur, strategist and producer. In 2015 he launched Brandathon, the world's first branding hackathon where talented creatives compete to re-imagine the branding of companies, big and small. Prior to Brandathon, he cofounded Melee Media, a brand consultancy delivering unique print, digital and interactive solutions to brands since 2010. His clients include Shutterstock, TransferWise, Offset, Hearst Corp, Warner Bros Records and Steve Madden. Prior to launching Melee, Malik worked as the Special Projects Director for TH Productions from 2006 through 2010. He is an avid traveler, writer and illustrator. 

About the Hosts:

Ramon Ray is the Marketing and Technology Evangelist at Infusionsoft and Founder of Smart Hustle Magazine. He is passionate about helping small businesses succeed by educating them about technology and marketing best practices.

He is a journalist, event producer (including Small Biz Big Things with Seth Godin), speaker, emcee and author. His third book is the Amazon.com bestseller Facebook Guide to Small Business Marketing (Wiley, Winter 2013)

Adam Wozney manages small business partnerships and events at Wix.com and the Wix Lounge, a co-working and event space for small businesses and entrepreneurs.

Adam specializes in strategic partnerships, experiential marketing, and communications. He is also a freelance digital marketing expert and amateur rock climber with a passion for civic engagement.

About the Venue:

Wix.com enables you to build a free and professional online presence, just the way you want it. With an HTML5 drag-and-drop website editor, 100s of web apps, designer-made templates, and tons of features, Wix gives you the tools to launch and manage your online presence.

So what are you waiting for? Sign up for a free Wix workshop today! Read less

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
Additional registration at Eventbrite REQUIRED!

Note: This is a musical performance at the German Consulate. This event is not exclusive to our group. Please follow the Consulate's rules for registration. I (Thomas, your Organizer) will unfortunately not be able to attend, but the consulate has staff members on-site that can help & assist you.


After finishing your RSVP here, please proceed to

http://agriculturaldreams.eventbrite.com


immediately to secure your spot. The Consulate's registration will close as soon as capacity is reached for this event.

The German Consulate General presents

Three excellent international musicians, Vadim, Ronen and Dan, all of them very talented artists in their own right, have come together to bring fresh and exciting music to New York City. At the German Consulate they will perform new compositions and also explore standard classics.


The Artists

Vadim Neselovskyi grew up in Odessa, Ukraine, where he was the youngest student to be accepted into the famous Odessa Conservatory. He then moved to Dortmund, Germany at the age of 17. Shortly after arriving in Germany, he established himself in the local jazz scene, taking part in the Dusseldorf Jazz Rally and Leipzig Jazz Days. After a few years he moved to the USA to further his studies at Berklee College of Music. Before graduating from Berklee, Vadim was asked to play and compose for a Berklee promotional recording produced by Pat Metheny. Just four weeks after his graduation, he was playing with Gary Burton at the Blue Note in New York. Since June 2004, Vadim has been consistently touring the US, Europe, Japan and Korea. Vadim's work has also been recognized with a number of recent awards. Additionally, he has been working as a Professor for Jazz Piano at world renowned Berklee College of Music in Boston  since January 2011.

Ronen Itzik is a multi-talented performer and composer. Audiences worldwide are captivated by his virtuosity, profound musicality and the passion he brings to performances. As a native of Jerusalem, Israel, Ronen incorporates his unique background and experience into his music. Since his arrival to the United States in December 2000, he has performed throughout the country, as well as in Europe, Central and South America, Canada and Israel. He has also performed and recorded with jazz greats such as Lee Konitz, Kenny Werner, Roy Hargrove, Hiromi Uehara, Ben Monder, Marcus Roberts, and Arnie Lawrence among many others, and has established his reputation as one of the most sought-after drummers and in-demand recording artist in New York City.

A fresh presence on the New York music scene, Dan Loomis has quickly become one the most in-demand bassists of his generation.  His musical roots lie in the historic jazz town of St. Louis, Missouri.  Dan has created a stir with both his powerful bass playing and his vision as a composer and bandleader.  He tours extensively throughout the US, Canada and Europe with his groups The Dan Loomis Quartet (DLQ), The Wee Trio, Spoke, and as a sideman with wildly diverse ensembles including the TS Monk Sextet, winning new audiences and bringing enthusiastic praise from critics.


Admission

Admission is free for this event, but your registration at 

http://agriculturaldreams.eventbrite.com is required to gain access.

How do I get there by subway?

6: 51st St

4/5/6/7: Grand Central Terminal

E/M: Lexington Av/53rd St

Since the event is near 1st Ave & 49th St, there is going to be a bit of a walk involved, keep that in mind for your timing & check google maps for details. 


I will not be able to join this event or assist you with access on-site, please don't forget to register at Eventbrite (see link atop) for guaranteed access. 


And - as always - change your RSVP status if your plans change. We appreciate it very much!


Thomas

results.description:
From humble beginnings, a handful of lost souls must rise above their misfortune to achieve greatness.

The uncountable islands of the subtropical Korina Archipelago are the sanctuary for many who have fled from the never-ending wars of distant Altamere. That land, where the life of the common man is cheap and reckless kings all-too-often burn their lives, and kingdoms, out in blazes of glory.

The Korina Archipelago is home to several large city-states, each of which views the others as rivals, but generally coexist, for there are greater threats to their safety. Renegade Altameran privateers, depraved nation-less pirates, demon-worshiping cannibals, horrors from the uncharted oceans, and far worse are reminders for the city-states of the constant dangers that exist outside their walls. 

These dangers are all-too-real, and to whom can one turn to in times of desperation and need when threats arise? Each city-state will defend its own, but outside that, help is not easy to come by. Even the enlightened gods favor all, yet they favor none; those whose prayers and sacrifices are the most persuasive bend their ears for a time. The gods are powerful and wise, but fickle they are, too, and to understand their ways is not the way of man.

This is no place for the weak of heart. Salvation comes from strength and strength alone. The strong survive, the weak do not. This is the tale of the rising of heroes, the elevation of men from what they were to what they are, the making of the great from the small, this is the story of ascension.
results.name: Ascension

results.description:
In 1973, NBC News scarily reported “shapeless, quivering masses” discovered in Texas. An alien invader? No, but pretty weird and wonderful stuff nonetheless: slime molds.  There are more than a thousand varieties (many dazzlingly yellow) that not only grow, but move (1/20 of an inch per hour), live for decades, and hibernate when circumstances require. While technically without a brain, they possess a kind of primitive problem-solving intelligence. All of this wonderment is brought to striking life by THE CREEPING GARDEN, a documentary that drolly indulges in “time magnification,” speeding up slime mold’s behavior so one can truly enjoy being thoroughly creeped out by it. Reports by naturalists, artists, and amateur slime mold connoisseurs are complemented by Jim O’Rourke’s appropriately trippy score.


“ENTIRELY FASCINATING. Explores slime molds with a dry wit… shooting the creeping goo (like the Blob in miniature) with a Lynchian beauty… Vibrant gelatinous slime molds pulsing with life. Heady and rigorous. An illuminating science documentary that tickles the imagination.” 
                                               – Serena Donadoni, Village Voice

Members Free, Non-Members - $5 

Film starts at 7:15PM

Sponsored by the Indoor Gardening Society of New York


About the Indoor Gardening Society...

IGS is a great way to introduce adults and children to the importance of green plants. The more you know about botany and growing things, the more you understand their impact on every aspect of your life and their importance to human survival. Plants are determining factors in many aspects of human history and development. Plants will beautify your home, heighten your appreciation of the outdoors and bring it inside for you to enjoy year-round. At each of our monthly meetings members enjoy:

-a lecture or program about a horticulture-related topic

-a plant sale making rare and unusual plants available at reasonable prices

-an exhibition of spectacular specimens often unknown to people outside the plant hobbyist world and often unseen at botanical gardens.

-access to supplies and information that can turn anyone from a novice to a successful grower

Try us out at any meeting for free! Monthly (except July and August) meeting details available here and on Facebook about the third week of each month.

Become a member of IGS and receive a free plant on the spot!

-$25 yearly membership includes your entire family

More info at the Facebook page of the Indoor Gardening Society of New York or call[masked] or email [masked]. We look forward to seeing you!

results.name: The Creeping Garden - A Slime-Mold Documentary

results.description:
125 RSVPs through Eventbrite so far - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/alley-boost-startup-investor-night-tickets-18583247995

Pitch 5 investors looking for early stage investments; You should only sign up for this event if you are going to raise money now or in the next 6 months.

You will get 10 Min – 1 min Set up. 6 min demo/presentation; 2 min Q&A with VCs; 1 min break down. Limited to 20 startups, a startup ticket gets you admission for one team member.

Prizes for the top 2 startups:

1st place

$200 credit towards any work on the Priori Legal platform.

$500 credit towards free data warehousing from Snowflake.

Consulting services for long-range planning and development, compliments of Boyden Global, who will partner with you towards the success of growing your platform to the next level.

2nd place

$500 credit towards free data warehousing from Snowflake.

You can buy regular admission tickets to watch the pitch night on Eventbrite - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/alley-boost-startup-investor-night-tickets-18583247995  

Please contact us if you are buying multiple tickets for the same startup because we will give you a discount code that will bring the cost of the additional ticket to $75.

Also, if you're interested in pitching at an upcoming investor night email <a>[masked]</a> to reserve a spot in advance. Come watch this one to gain valuable insights and tips so your pitch is effective next time.


Agenda:

6 - 7 pm Pitches

7 - 7:15 pm Break

7:15 - 8 pm Pitches

8 - 8:30 pm Networking with VCs/Angels

Light refreshments and hors d’oeuvres will be served

WeWork, our host sponsor, is home to over 14,000 entrepreneurs and creators in New York City. WeWork provides the space, community, and services that small businesses need in order to create a life, not just a living. With new locations opening soon (Wall Street, Penn Station, and Times Square), WeWork is growing it's diverse community in Manhattan.

To book a tour and become a part of their community, click here or simply email Kate at <a>[masked]</a>.

The Judges

Shawn Cheng, Principal, Vayner Capital

Shawn Cheng is a Principal at Vayner Capital, Gary Vaynerchuk’s venture capital firm. Vayner's focus is on Seed and Series A investments for startups in need of strategic guidance in growth and storytelling. Prior to joining he worked in Strategy, Digital Advertising, Social Media and Search at BBDO, Razorfish and VaynerMedia for 10 years. During that time he helped to builddozens of brands such as, Mondelez, GE, Mondelez, Starwood Hotels and Victoria’s Secret.

He has been a startup mentor for three years through the Entrepreneurs Roundtable Accelerator and helped to create dozens of emerging tech partnerships and programs.

Jeremy Harper, Principal, Entrepreneurs Roundtable Accelerator

Jeremy is an Associate at Entrepreneurs Roundtable Accelerator, focusing on early stage technology investing and mentoring across multiple sectors, both enterprise and consumer. Jeremy was previously an early employee on the Booz Allen Hamilton commercial team, a digital strategist for Unilever, and the head of marketing for The5thMedium. Jeremy received a B.A. from Brown University.

Greg Matthews, Head of Business Development, Founder Therapy

Greg Matthews is the Head of Business Development at FounderTherapy, a product development shop that helps early stage startups move into their growth stage. As an entrepreneur himself, Greg helps founders acquire the necessary technology and business leadership to build their company.

With over 15 years of experience as Founders, CTO’s , and CPO’s, the FounderTherapy team leverages their collective experience to help early stage companies build successful products the first time.

Jay Levy, Partner, Zelkova VC 

Jay levy is a co-founder and partner of zelkova ventures. Jay focuses most of his time in working with the current portfolio company and looking at new investments in the software-as-a-service, internet media and green tech space. 

Jay launched his entrepreneurial career while in high school with his first web-services firm, providing web development services to early stage companies. After high school, jay moved to new jersey to attend rutgers university, where he studied finance & political science. While at rutgers he helped to launch uconnections.com an internet portal for college students merging the office campus community with the dorm. While still in college jay went to work for morgan stanley working on the development of their separately managing account business. After leaving morgan stanley, jay helped to launch mpi professionals a new york based financial service consultancy which was later acquired by a publicly traded multi-national. More recently jay was a founding partner of trueview services, an online monitoring solution targeted to the small business and residential market. 

Dimitris Kouvaros, Director of Accelerator Operations, Newark Venture Partners

Dimitris Kouvaros, NVP’s Director of Accelerator Operations and a member of the fund’s early stage investment team, has been a leader of various startup initiatives in the New York metro area, including his roles as Co-Director of NYC Startup Next (acquired by Techstars), Co-Organizer of TechBrunch, NYC Organizer of Startup Weekend, and COO of the Baruch Investment Management Group, a student-run investment fund.   Prior to that, Dimitris headed business developments for Huddle Metrics and for Placemeter, a Techstars 2013 Class company, and was a member of Silicon Valley Bank’s Early Stage team within the bank’s Entrepreneur Services Group in New York.  Dimitris holds a Bachelor of Business Administration degree from CUNY-Baruch College, and is an avid Mets fan, an occasional standup comic, and co-creator of Live! From Tomorrow, a startup-focused late night talk show on Meerkat.

John Albright, Co-Founder and Managing Partner, Relay Ventures

John is Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Relay Ventures, an early stage venture fund exclusively focused on mobile connectivity, with offices in Toronto and Menlo Park.  John currently serves as a director of Fuse Powered, Touch Bistro, Nymi, Blue Ant Media, InPowered, Difference Capital Funding, theScore and OCAD University.  In addition, John serves as an advisor to The Next 36, Ryerson Digital Media Zone, and OCAD University’s Imagination Catalyst.  John is a Chartered Financial Analyst and received his Bachelor of Business Administration degree from the Schulich School of Business at York University 

Jay Thakrar, Venture Capitalist, SeedInvest

Jay heads up deal sourcing at SeedInvest, a leading investment platform which connects 13,000+ institutional and accredited investors with $495MM+ in collective investor interest to highly-vetted startup investment opportunities. Prior to SeedInvest, Jay was an Investment Associate at Cambridge Associates (CA), where he specialized in private equity and venture capital. Before CA, he led business development at SoluSoft, where he focused on product management and marketing for business process management solutions. He also founded a music and event management company, JT Entertainers, which specialized in private and corporate events globally. He studied Entrepreneurship, Finance, and Marketing at Babson College and Managerial Economics and Strategy at the London School of Economics. During his time at Babson, he was also an Entrepreneurship Mentor on campus. In his spare time, Jay enjoys training karate, mixing music, traveling the world, and exploring new cuisines.

Angelia Müller, Director, XRC Labs

Ms. Müller serves as the Director of XRC Labs, a retail and consumer product focused accelerator in New York City. XRC Labs is the brainchild of Parsons School of Design, Kurt Salmon Retail Consulting Group, and Harvard I-Lab. Previously, Angie founded Inspir.nation, a marketing and consulting service for startups in the SF Bay Area. Prior to joining XRC, Angie led New Client Acquisition at IBM, where she scaled millennial engagement across 7 divisions. Angie is also the advisor to the chairman at SDL group.

Christian Noske, Investment Principal, BMW i Ventures 

Christian Noske is a Senior Associate with BMW i Ventures. Christian focuses on early stage investments in Navigation & Traffic, Smart Parking and Consumer Internet. He also manages BMW’s Incubator space in New York and is the organizer of the NY Future Mobility Meetup. Prior to joining BMW i Ventures, Christian was CFO for a digital agency that was acquired by WPP, and worked in Finance and Business Development for Robert Bosch GmbH in Germany and Asia. Christian holds a degree in Business Informatics from the State University Stuttgart in Germany.

Mark Wachen, Managing Director, Upstage Ventures / DreamIt Ventures

Mark Wachen is the Managing Director of Upstage Ventures, a firm that advises and invests in consumer internet and interactive marketing companies. Wachen is also a Managing Director of DreamIt Ventures, one of the world's leading accelerator programs. Previously, Wachen founded Optimost, the company that pioneered multivariate testing and optimization online. Wachen served as its CEO up until its acquisition by Interwoven in 2007. Prior to Optimost, Wachen was Vice President of Online Ventures for Sony Music. Wachen graduated summa cum laude from Dartmouth and has an MBA from Harvard.

Steven Greenberg, Analyst & Product Manager, ff Venture Capital

Steven is an analyst at ff Venture Capital, an early stage fund based in New York. Prior to joining ffVC, Steven served as a Project Assistant to the CEO of Aol, Tim Armstrong. Steven was a Co-founder of Unroll.me (acquired by Rakuten), an email subscription management tool which has helped its 2 million users block over 5 billion unwanted newsletters. He additionally held roles as a Product Developer at the Huffington Post and as a Digital Strategist at MKTG.

Sumeet Shah, Senior Associate, Brand Foundry 

Ventures Sumeet is responsible for sourcing, executing, and monitoring new opportunities at Brand Foundry Ventures. He has 6 years of experience across the startup and private equity industries, formerly running new business strategies at Gist Digital and handling business development and project work at Gotham Consulting Partners. Sumeet graduated from Columbia University with a degree in Biomedical Engineering, specializing in Biomechanics.

Matt J. Moisan, Moisan Legal P.C. 

Matthew Moisan is an attorney, an entrepreneur, and an innovator. Matthew strives to add value to his clients’ beyond providing boilerplate legal services. He and his firm, Moisan Legal, PC, represent the digital age entrepreneur.


Peter Nicholas, Director of Investment Strategy, Facilitated Growth 

Before joining Facilitated Growth in 2013, as a series 7 and 63 registered representative, Pete was involved in investments spanning both the public and private markets. At National Securities, he maintained client relationships, managed client accounts, and oversaw a team of people. As Director of Investment Strategy at FG, he is currently using his assets to assist entrepreneurs in navigating through the early stages of the business process, with a focus on investor sentiment. His ability to read and assess situations is considered by the partners when making a proprietary investment.


Swatick Majumdar, Venture Partner, Digital Entertainment Ventures (DEV) 

Swatick Majumdar is the Venture Partner of Digital Entertainment Ventures (DEV). Previously he was a Managing Director at Chatsworth Securities, LLC a Greenwich, CT based boutique investment bank. At Chatsworth he directed all his attention to the investment banking activities in the US-India corridor where he helped execute numerous successful financings in various sectors such as Technology, Media and Telecommunication (TMT), Renewable Energy (new and traditional), Biotechnology and Medical devices. He has been active as an advisor in the start-up evolution of companies and brings a wealth of global relationships, expertise and operating history to the team at DEV. He serves as a board observer at Easy Energy Systems, a renewable energy company and Global Path Capital.


Thank you to our sponsor!

Moisan Legal P.C. utilizes technology to foster a collaborative client/attorney interaction. Our goal is to be your ongoing strategic resource and enable your business to operate effectively.

Facilitated Growth is a business and management consultancy committed to assisting entrepreneurs seeking expansion through the various phases of the business cycle.

Sportwip is an enterprise health and engagement platform that allows companies to reward top performers to memorable and meaningful experiences, including yoga, skydiving, spa treatments, and more.

From entity formation to business dissolution and every transaction in between, our attorneys work to ensure that your business operates on a sound legal footing with your best interests promoted and protected.

We’re a passionate and powerful team. Tech-savvy, creative and driven to provide the most efficient and valuable legal services for our clients. We understand the cost associated with starting a new business. We provide legal services to meet your needs, focusing on making your business function at its full potential.

We’re entrepreneurs as well, each having developed other successful (and, at times, some unsuccessful) companies, so we understand what it’s like to be in our clients’ shoes.

Call for a consultation, [masked]

Also, check out the Alley Boost website.

results.description:
This meetup group was started by the founder of the DaniWeb.com IT Discussion Community who was getting frustrated that all of the meetups she was interested in attending were based in NYC, and it was nearly impossible to get to them on weeknights for people who work out on Long Island.

Join a group of people who work in the tech industry throughout Long Island.

We are a very informal group consisting mostly of web developers and IT consultants, with the occasional application developer thrown into the mix. We talk about the latest projects we're working on and get help and feedback from each other.

The meetup starts at 6 pm but running as late as 10 or 11 pm (sometimes even later!) is the norm. People typically arrive anytime between 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't miss out just because you can't get there by 6. There's usually an early crowd and a late crowd.

We will also be playing two card games: Cards against humanity and the new game SUPER FIGHT card games. Those who aren't familar with the new cool superfight game, here is the video showing you how to play it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oftjijhP-fs


____________________________________________ Meetup happy hour specials at Action Burger:

Meetup Happy hour specials:
3 shots for $5.
32oz rum and coke $10.
Buy a beer, get a free shot.
$20 Rum & coke, open bar for 2 hours. Unlimited 16oz rum and cokes for one person for two hours.
Cheese Burger fries & Soda $8. Comes with up to 5 of the free toppings.

_______________________________________________
See you there. Written rules for SuperFight:

SUPERFIGHT BASIC RULES

The Setup:
Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

Youngest player goes first. Player one
starts by drawing three white cards and
three black cards. You can look at them,
but don’t let anyone else see them.
Player two (the next player to the left) does
the same.

Each player chooses one white card and
one black card from their hand to create a
fighter and places those cards face down.
Then they discard their remaining cards
into two separate piles (one for characters,
one for attributes).
Next, both players turn over their cards and
reveal their fighters.
Each player then draws a random black
card from the deck and adds it to their
fighter.

The Superfight:
Both players argue and plead their cases
about why their fighters would win the fight.
Once the arguing is done, the table votes
for a winner.

In the event of a tie, both players draw a
random white card and fight to the death
with no attributes. The table votes again. Do
this until there is a winner, then discard the
white cards from the tiebreaker fights.
The winning fighter stays on the table for
the next player to fight and will not get any
new attributes in the next fight. The player
who won the fight earns one point.

The Next Match:
Player three (the next player to the left) now
creates a fighter to battle the winner from
the last match, following the same rules for
fighter creation as in The Setup. Then The
Superfight begins again.

ALTERNATE RULES

Villain Battle:
Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

Every player draws three white cards and
three black cards. You can look at them, but
don’t let anyone else see them. The least liked
person at the table takes the first turn
as the Villain.

The Villain chooses one white card and one
black card from their hand and places those
cards face up on the table. Then the Villain
draws one random black card from the
deck and adds it to their fighter.

All other players choose one white card and
one black card from their hands to create
fighters to defeat the Villain. When everyone
is ready, reveal the fighters one at a time and
announce them to the table. Starting with the
player to the left of the Villain, play an
additional black card from your hand onto
any fighter on the table (including the Villain
or yourself!) and then discard the rest of your
hand.

Next the Villain picks who would do the best
against his or her fighter. That fighter wins
the battle and gets one point.
The player to the left of the current Villain
becomes the new Villain. Every player draws
three new white cards and three new black
cards, and a new battle begins.

Battle Royale:

Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

All players draw three white cards and three
black cards. You can look at them, but don’t
let anyone else see them. Each player places
one white card and one black card face
down on the table. One at a time, players
reveal their fighters and announce the
fighters to the table.

Before playing the second black card, select
one of the following game modes:

A) Each fighter’s second black card is drawn
randomly from the deck.

B) Players may play one additional black
card from their hands onto any fighter at
the table (including themselves).
Everyone votes on which fighter would be
the last one standing.

Pacifists:
Follow any of the rules outlined above, but
this time choose the winner based on who
is the funniest, or imagine it’s a dating
website and you’re picking the best match.
Pick who would be the best construction
worker, or nanny, or use your imagination!

Finally:
Unlike other judge-based games, this is not
anonymous. If a player is being biased, for
whatever dumb reason, never play with
that person again. They are lame, and
should go play charades with their cats
until they learn how to play with people.
Imagine the fighters are fighting on an
island or anywhere you want, but New York
is a good default.

results.description:
Join us this Tuesday for a special Intercambio y acción de gracias fiesta! For this week's session, participants are invited to bring a traditional food dish from your native culture.

Feel free to bring along a friend! The $3 fee will be waived for first-time attendees as well as any participant who brings a food item.

Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.
Everyone is welcome!

results.description:
Hi everyone

Wow, it's been a busy month and I haven't had the opportunity to do much scouting for new venues.  However, we have had a great time at this place the past few times we've gone and it's always nice to go to Queens!  I'm not just saying that because I work in Queens and it's easy to get here!

 They have good beer, great food and they love us.  It is quick to get to via M,R, N or Q trains. Look forward to seeing you there. If you take M or R it's just about a block from the Steinway stop.  Cheers!

Bill

6:30 - 7:00pm...Networking, Pizza, and Beer

7:00 - 7:25pm - Ori Inbar overview of AWE Asia conference

7:30 - 8:00pm - Demo by Membit

Membit is a geolocative photo sharing app that allows pictures to be placed and viewed in the exact location they were captured. Membit's patented Human Positioning System TM allows for markerless AR to be used anytime, anywhere, by anyone.


Demos to be announced

8:00 - 8:30 pm...Member announcements and Networking


See you there!
results.name: ARNY Meetup (Presenting: Ori Inbar-AWE Asia, Membit)

results.description:
Should we resist the urge to apply the same paradigms as earlier large-scale solutions to IoT, or do you believe there's an IoT stack in the making?


The tech community may be tempted to define an IoT stack to make sense of how the many pieces of the IoT puzzle are enabled, or to claim which standards, protocols, approaches, services, hardware or software may 'win'. 

Join us to hear the perspective that 'There is no IoT stack!' from Tom Luczak, Co-Founder and CTO of flowthings.io. Tom will also run a test drive of the flowthings.io platform that turns data into intelligent action.

Agenda:

• 6:30-7pm: sign-in, food/drink and discussion

• 7-7:15: Welcome, topic intro, member announcements/asks [Linda Drabik, organizer IoT NY meetup]

• 7:15-8:30pm: There is no IoT stack! [Tom Luczak, Co-founder and CTO, flowthings.io]

Thank you to our sponsor:


Rackspace
results.name: IoT NY #25 - There is no IoT stack!

results.description:
Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5939 is required

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5939 is required 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5939
results.name: Speed BOWLING NYC- AGES 20's, 30's, 40's (prepay required)

You are invited to our Aperitivo con amici. Bring your friends and stories to share! There is no participation fee, and the event is cash bar.

Grazie,

ITALIANI NYC - www.ITALIANIALLESTERO.TV &

ITALIAN CHAT, NYC

MOW TO FIND US:

We We will be near the bar area near the entrance; just ask about the Italian Meetup as you enter. Ask for your Host, Riccardo.

results.name: Aperi-TV con amici

results.description:
The new and fun way to find your new roommate. Whether you want to meet some people to find a new place with, or if you have a spare room you'd like to fill, this is a fun and social way to get it done.

Why sort through hundreds of e-mails to set up roommate interviews, only to get rejected?

Why spend an entire weekend letting strangers into your house?

It's a casual and fun event that allows you to have a drink with potential roommates and see if there is any roommate chemistry brewing. Best of all, there is no charge to come to the event. Yes, it's FREE.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll have a sign  on the table where we are sitting.
results.name: Mingle with Potential Roommates

results.description:
Our last Bowling Meetup sold out! And this might be our final one of the year so don't miss it!! 

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1GYmD0h

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1KTpov6

Mix & mingle before bowling with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

Next the fun begins.  A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Then a member of the male team will bowl a frame. The process continues until all 10 frames are bowled. The group that has the highest score of each game wins a prize!

At end of game, ladies will stay at the same lane. Male team will rotate to next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address. 

What's included:

• Free Bowling Games, Shoe Rental & Scorecard Matching 

• Snacks & Ice Breakers

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Grey Goose Drink Specials 

• Prizes for winning team

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1GYmD0h

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1KTpov6

Prepay Only Event - No tickets sold at door 

Can I still attend even If I don't want to bowl?  Yes, you can still be a member of the team and mingle.  Food & Drink will also be available for purchase. 

Can I come alone?  Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +30?  This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  About 40 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+.

How do I attend?  RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5939
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
Our last Bowling Meetup sold out! And this might be our final one of the year so don't miss it!! 

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1GYmD0h

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1KTpov6

Mix & mingle before bowling with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

Next the fun begins.  A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Then a member of the male team will bowl a frame. The process continues until all 10 frames are bowled. The group that has the highest score of each game wins a prize!

At end of game, ladies will stay at the same lane. Male team will rotate to next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

• Free Bowling Games, Shoe Rental & Scorecard Matching 

• Snacks & Ice Breakers

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Grey Goose Drink Specials 

• Prizes for winning team

results.description:
Book Description:


Peter Lime is trained to hunt down his prey and catch them on film. But now he is the one being hunted. Whose prey has he become? And what is it that he has that these people will kill to get? Lime is a Danish paparazzo, living in Madrid. For more than 20 years he has stalked and captured the rich and famous on film, making vast sums of money from exposing their secrets - the more salacious the image, the bigger the fee. But lately he's been thinking of giving it up. His wife and child have changed his life, and now he dreams of doing a job that his daughter can be proud of. Then he goes on a routine assignment, snapping a Spanish minister out sailing with his mistress, and suddenly his world is turned upside down. When a fire destroys his home, but not all of his photographs, Lime sets out to discover a motive and finds himself drawn into the complex and terrifying web of international terrorism.

results.description:
Come and meet our community of local real estate investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. We constantly learn & earn together and have fun together. Within our real estate investing community, we train people with no experience to people who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So it's not important what experience you have! Working with our community, you will learn in depth knowledge of how real estate investing strategies work and you will also develop yourself to be a successful real estate entrepreneur.

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about new investors that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, we will also talk about how you can make $1,000-$10,000 commissions helping our community grow and you will learn working strategies from professional and practicing Real Estate Investors on how to create wealth through real estate investing.. This way you can learn & earn, get educated so you can invest in real estate, enjoy your life and pass your wealth on to future generations. Because we will cover a LOT of things in a short amount of time such as saving money on taxes, investment opportunities and other ways to make money working with our team, only those who attend the orientation will get invited to private follow up meetings to cover more in depth advanced strategies and working with our community.

To attend, simply RSVP & answer the registration questions for location! If you would like to bring a friend or business partner with you to the meeting, please email us their name, email address and phone number so that we can make sure they are registered for the meeting.
results.name: Learn About Our Real Estate Investing Community, Training & Income Opportunity!

results.description:
Ever wanted to build a quirky hardware project? In this workshop we will build several prototypes of musical chimes each one more creative than the other!

Example Videos: Flower chimes

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2-iFNLQLxQc

Electric wind chimes

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gQoL5-CF7r4

Materials provided:

• 5 bare touch conductive boards

• 2 makeymakey

• 1 arduino

• 1 tube of conductive thread

• 2 5-packages of alligator cables

• flowers

• aluminium foil

What you should bring: • Your computer with Arduino IDE installed and Baretouch Conductive Board drivers installed (follow instructions here: http://www.bareconductive.com/make/setting-up-arduino-with-your-touch-board/) • Headphones and/or little speakers (if you have any) • More materials for chimes (felt, bells, LEDs, anything else you can think of) What you can keep: the chimes you made

What you cannot keep: the boards provided

We encourage you to bring more materials for chimes and to set-up Arduino on your computer to make the most out if it! 

Teacher:  Stefania Druga

Innately curious and passionate about creating and testing new learning models, instructional designer by training, evolved into a learning architect. Stefania is also a former Googler and graduated from an international Erasmus Mundus master of Media Engineering for Education (France, Spain, Portugal). In the summer of 2012 she was also the Education Teaching Fellow at Singularity University where she advised and coached 80 students from 36 countries. Currently, she is leading Hackidemia organization (mobile lab for maker Education present in 40 countries), Afrimakers (community of Maker projects in 10 Africa countries) and MakerCamp (global camps for learning how to build and run makerspaces) Stefania is also an an ambassador for global MakerFaire in Berlin and Shenzhen and is preparing a new kit for maker education in schools. Currently she is a Flatiron School fellow and NYU visiting scholar and she is always looking for creative ways to combine hardware and software with art, music and design. 


Schedule: 

6:30 Arrive/Network/Food
6:45 Welcome from Girl Develop It and Dev Bootcamp
7:00 Workshop begins
9:15 Demo and enjoy your final prototype!

A $15 donation toward our scholarship fund is requested to guarantee your seat for participation. Please be sure to enter your full name when RSVPing for this event.
results.name: Arduino Hardware Workshop

Be Social Change is a community-driven nonprofit on a mission to educate and connect the next generation of change makers. Through community-building, entrepreneurship education, and resource-sharing platforms we empower people from all sectors and industries to pursue work they are passionate about and create lives that make the world a better place.

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/izh323eQvDaKMjfVmnlMl_NBoJtmmrquCKIFXpFcV3dJHV4e41G4PT6cS5qqncASmn8oZcDhXIPjokCoNxz6GS8ck0XEA3WEEtQKi7KAqB-nZ3oEwqxt0tc84Xqwbz_V=s1600

Taproot Foundation, a national nonprofit, connects nonprofits and social change organizations with skilled volunteers through pro bono service. Taproot is creating a world where organizations dedicated to social change have full access—through pro bono service—to the marketing, strategy, HR, and IT resources they need to be most effective. Since 2001, Taproot’s skilled volunteers have served 3,700 social change organizations providing 1.5 million hours of work worth over $147 million in value. Taproot is located in New York, San Francisco, Chicago, Los Angeles and Washington, D.C. and is leading a network of global pro bono providers in over 23 countries around the world.


Taproot+ is an online platform built by the Taproot Foundation that helps nonprofit professionals describe their needs and connect to a curated group of motivated, ready skilled volunteers with the right skills to help. We've built on our 13 years in pro bono to create a low-touch, high-impact model that makes pro bono easier to access and manage on both sides. A nonprofit and a skilled volunteer will work together on short-term, high-impact projects such as a video short or a competitor analysis. Learn more and get started today!

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 6:30PM - 8:30PM

This month's host: devbootcamp

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!
results.name: Tuesday Office Hours

results.description:
NOTE: *Only those, who have applied and been confirmed will be eligible to pitch. It’s possible that not all interested parties will be able to speak as there are time constraints and we’ve noticed considerable interest in the event. However, all group members will be allowed to watch / attend the event (please RSVP regardless).*

To apply to pitch, please message us on Meetup or send an email.

RuTech is curating a speaking event where we invite you to join us for an opportunity to watch your fellow RuTech entrepreneur pitch their ideas and companies in front of a panel of investors, entrepreneurs, and executives from our pool of over 350 investors, technology professionals & entrepreneurs

Judges and audience will provide feedback on the pitches. 

The host of this event will be our friends at Intellectsoft. In celebration of Mobile Roadie joining the Intellectsoft family, the best pitch of the night will take home a one-year subscription to Mobile Roadie self-service mobile app platform (valued at $1499).

After each pitch we'll open the floor to feedback from the judges and the audience. Both before and after the event, there will be an excellent opportunity to mingle and exchange info.

(Please note that the main event will be in English)

We look forward to seeing everyone! :)


Event Format:

Mingling

Intros and a short keynote by our guest speaker

Startup presentations and feedback (startups that applied / confirmed)

Short Q&A

Mingling


Startups that will be pitching:

Jointle 

Jointle is an online venue where the makers put their offers (campaigns) and aims for production of certain goods in specified time and for fixed prices. Customers in their turn, support their aims by way of pre-payments (by paying in advance). 


PaperFree
PaperFree.com is a flexible business management system capable of managing enterprise's web sites, order forms, calls, emails, scripts, document templates, projects, strategies, business processes, culture and more. PaperFree.com understands and supports companies facing rapid growth.

Famebeat
Famebeat is LinkedIn married SoundCloud. The platform provides a stream of information from trusted sources, industry connections and interest groups, talent finding tool for industry pros and promotion tools for artists: opportunities, statistics, charts & media sharing. 

Dream Forward
Dream Forward Financial sells businesses a new kind of 401(k) plan with low costs, no conflicts of interest, and a modern website. We focus on helping employees feel more confident that they can actually afford to save for retirement and not keep putting it off.

Virtzy 

Virtzy changes the way Beauty and Wellness Professionals build their brand! Our mission is to empower these professionals by bringing their unique talent online and allowing them to showcase their skills and build their brand!


Webabot 
Open source platform for home automation tasks, including software (server/client) and hardware. Can be cloud-hosted or self-hosted. The main goal is to make it easy to build and extend to meet your own needs.



Leaseforlease


Leaseforlease is an online automotive marketplace where consumers can lease cars online! We give consumers a new hassle free way to lease their car, assuring them they got the best deal and the best experience! 

About our awesome sponsors:

Intellectsoft, the host of the event,has been developing, marketing and maintaining mobile applications since 2007, serving clients as diverse as the London Stock Exchange, Guinness, and L’Oreal along the way. Today it’s experienced team is spread across seven global offices, collaborating on projects from Silicon Valley to Scandinavia. For more information, please visit www.intellectsoft.net.  

WeWork is the platform for creators. We provide the workspace, community, and services you need to make a life, not just a living.  To learn more about the WeWork locations in New York City, click here to book a tour or send an email to [masked]. 

Clever Solution is a digital design, development and marketing company. The team was built primarily to support startups, and it perfectly covers most of startup technology needs. With a full-time staff of 25, Clever Solution has the following capabilities:

- Design
- MVP
- Development of web applications
- Development of mobile applications
- Digital marketing including SEO

You can learn more at clever-solution.com

results.description:
Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5939 is required

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5939 is required 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5939

results.description:
This will be a 4 mile run or so through the streets of Rutherford.  If you want a completely flat run, this run's not for you as there are gradual uphills and downhills throughout the run.


****Please wear reflective clothing, a vest, or some kind of light.  It is important that we are clearly visible to vehicles on our route regardless of which route we choose.  Thank you.****

IF YOU'RE NOT GOING TO MAKE IT, PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP PRIOR TO THE EVENT.  AS THE WEATHER GETS COLDER IT WILL BECOME LESS LIKELY THAT WE'LL WAIT FOR YOUR ARRIVAL.


We tend to run a different route each week.  Here's one potential route that we may take:

http://www.gmap-pedometer.com/?r=6388502


We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a few minutes past 6:30 PM to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.  Looking forward to seeing you.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the train station.  Look for us closer to the tracks.  Look for people in running clothes.
results.name: 4 Mile Run in Rutherford - meet at Rutherford Train Station

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book The Technique of the Disciple by Raymund Andrea.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 5: The Will of the Neophyte.

You can download the book free here!

About the Book

The Technique of the Disciple is a book containing a modem description of the ancient esoteric path to spiritual illumination, trod by the masters and avatars of yore. It has long been said that Christ left, as a great heritage to members of His secret council, a private method for guidance in life, which method has been preserved until today in the secret, occult, mystery schools.

In this book, Raymund Andrea has created a masterful account of the challenges and rewards awaiting those who dare to venture on the ancient path to mystical awakening. He reveals the method for attaining a greater life taught in these mystery schools, which perhaps parallels the secret instructions of Christ to members of His council.

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Technique of the Disciple: Will of the Neophyte

results.description:
This week I am going to see Mockingjay Part 2 I will arrive at 6:45 for the 7:15 pm showing. I  have seat E11 If you are coming post your seat #  Meet in lobby after if you want to got to diner after.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie


Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Fri/Sat) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to drive there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!!    Love, Cassie

PS: I am doing this with my friendship group too so if you are S&L do wear your wristbands. If you need to buy one let me know, they are just $1 These are loads of fun at the movies though they glow in the dark!

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!
results.how_to_find_us: assinged seats
results.name: $5.50 Movie Night- Mockingjay Part 2
