results.description:
Become the best damn hypnotist you can – Tuesday night* Practice Group

NEO-ERICKSONIAN HYPNOSIS PRACTICE GROUP – Join us for our regular on-going Practice Group and become the best damn hypnotist you can be!

*Every second and forth Tuesday evening of the month. Continues May 12th and 26th for 2 hours, 7 PM to 9 PM at the TRS Suites in New York City.

Each meeting will focus on something new or in need of practice so we can improve our skills and expand our range. We’ll watch videos of Milton Erickson in action and take the time to dissect them and really learn from them. You’ll learn and share new techniques. We’ll swap scripts. We’ll swap books and other media. Above all, we’ll PRACTICE and get GOOD.

One benefit you get from attending is the group support of learning. Last time we met we watched a couple of hours of a newly available DVD set called “In the Room with Milton Erickson.” It’s how Erickson taught Ericksonian Hypnosis. Up to maybe a dozen people would squeeze into his office and listen to him speak and watch him do demos. Now YOU can be in that room too. It’s pretty amazing, really, and SO instructive. I love it.

AND – it’s only $20 a night! (Amazing deal.)

Open to graduates of Doug’s NLP or Hypnosis trainings or students who have received similar training from other reputable training centers.

TUESDAY evening, May 12th

TRS Professional Suite, 40 Exchange Place, New York City, NY

7:00pm – 9:00pm

* NOTE – Please arrive EARLY so we can start at 7:00


CLICK HERE - ONLY $20 (via PayPal)

Doug O'Brien
Certified Master Practitioner and Trainer of Neuro-Linguistic Programming; Ericksonian Hypnotherapist
</a><a href="http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com/">http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com
http://www.ericksonian.com

As a Hypnotherapist, Doug helped found the Department of Complementary Medicine at Columbia Presbyterian Hospital in the mid-nineties, under Dr. Mehmet Oz. Doug worked directly with pre-operative and post-operative patients on stress management and pain reduction as well as long term behavioral change to generate healthy living.

Doug O'Brien, is an NLP Master Trainer - originally given that designation by Anthony Robbins over 20 years ago - and is called a modern Shaman by some. He is also a musician and composer and a Trance Master Guide.

He is the guy who gave Tony Robbins an insight that completely changed Tony's approach to his second book (it was going to be called "The Niagara Syndrome" and became, instead, "Awaken the Giant Within")

Doug is the guy who has been the success coach to two of the top internet marketers in the country as well as corporate executives, top musical artists, fashion designers and professional athletes.

He has helped literally tens of thousands of people quit smoking in one session.
He has helped similar numbers lose weight and keep it off through the power of Hypnosis.

He can help YOU, too.

Endorsements/Testimonials
“I have attended all three of Doug’s Trance Night sessions. Each experience has been extremely powerful with noticeable results and the impact has lasted. I am definitely looking forward to attending the future Trance Nights.”
– Jackie

"Best Meet-up ever.”
– Kate

“Your Trance Night was a wonderful respite from the world. It was like a vacation from all of the stresses of every day life, a vacation for my soul. It continues to ripple though me today. So glad I came.”

– Marshall

results.description:
There are new rules and <a>regulations</a> concerning the Tuesday <a>night</a> games. Please scroll down and read them all before signing up for the event.


There may not be space for you if you don't.


<a>Table</a> Top Role <a>Playing</a> Game Night!


This is the official <a>RPG game</a> night of the NY SciFi/Fan Meetup Group.

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.


Can I run my own game?: If you would like to run your own game, please contact Justin or Cat to reserve a slot.


Need Dice?: Please bring yours if you have some if you need extra I will provide some.

Games Currently Running:

Jutin: Full Steam Ahead 

A new steampunk-inspired RPG by Justin.

Cat: Monster of the Week

A game of investigating and fighting the things that go bump in the night. This campaign is set in a fictional California city a few years after WWII

Current Roster:

Liz

Joseph

Mike

Alden
results.name: NY SciFi & Fantasy Tabletop Role Playing and Game Night

Hi Everyone,

Our next Meetup will take place on:

Tuesday, November 24, 2015 at 7 PM at Mirage Diner ,

717 Kings Highway, on the corner of E. 8th Street in Brooklyn.

Take the F train to Kings Highway and McDonald Avenue, where you can connect to the B82 bus towards Pennsylvania Ave., or the B or Q trains to Kings Highway and E. 16th Street, where you can connect to the B82 bus towards Cropsey Ave.  For those who are driving, a parking lot is available at the diner.

The only requirement is that you order a minimum of $6.00 worth of food and/or drink during our Meetup.

We will be meeting in the back room.  Please ask for Michele when you arrive.  There is a wheelchair accessible ramp, if anyone has difficulty climbing steps and there's a wheelchair accessible bathroom as well. If you use the ramp, you will be entering through the back room.

Thank you for joining our group. I look forward to meeting all of you at our Meetup. Let's make it a great night of making new friends and helping each other!

All the best,

Michele

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your FALL with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

-nine-zero-eight-three-zero-three-five-zero-three-one-


Looking forward to training with you!

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of rsvp's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending.  If you have questions about the event or how many are coming contact the event host at [masked] or call[masked]

You don't have to be a genius to participate in this Trivia Night! Come  out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition! Test your skills as New York Social Network Founder Dave Cervini hosts a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. We will have special sections set aside for NYSN members to meet and team up.  Pay as you go for food and drink. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round! We will rotate everyone to new teams after each round (unless you have a  team already)

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but St Pat's is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? They have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's Irish specialites and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7:pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stay and socialize and other head home.

How do I get there? The B,D,F Stop at Rock Center
results.name: Fun and Easy Rotating Team Trivia Night~FREE

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
Dorothy Cummings will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment by The Gotham Gals.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest! 

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.name: English Country Dance with Dorothy Cummings and The Gotham Gals!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
"Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Today, our membership is 260,000 strong. These members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 12,500-plus clubs that make up our global network of meeting locations.

How Does It Work?

A Toastmasters meeting is a learn-by-doing workshop in which participants hone their speaking and leadership skills in a friendly atmosphere. A typical group has 20 to 40 members who meet weekly, biweekly or monthly. A typical meeting lasts 60 – 90 minutes.There is no instructor in a Toastmasters meeting. Instead, members evaluate one another’s presentations. This feedback process is a key part of the program’s success. Meeting participants also give impromptu talks on assigned topics, conduct meetings and develop skills related to timekeeping, grammar and parliamentary procedure."

Why should I join?
The Toastmasters program offers many benefits that help people in all walks of life. As a result of participating in Toastmasters, you will:

Increase your self-confidenceBecome a better speakerBecome a better leaderCommunicate more effectively

Membership is affordable – a great value that can change your life that costs less than a dollar a day. Your initial investment:

$20 New member fee $36 Dues for six months, plus any club expenses. (Some clubs may charge a nominal fee in addition to the regular dues for items such as meeting space and club supplies.)

More than 4 million people have discovered the benefits of this proven learning formula. What are you waiting for?

Alright! I've been raving about this place for a looong time now. Those that were with us last week got the prelude to this divine little joint helmed by one of my favorite chefs, Alex Stupak. Empellon is a small empire. They have a great brand and even better, great food and drink to go with it.


Alex is a purist about staying true to Mexican food. His tacos visually created allow you to peer into that mind of a classically trained chef doing great Mexican food. You can see the love when you spot the roasted pork on a spit sandwiched between pineapple.  The Tortilla's, the sauces, all amazing, all made in house from scratch for your delight.


This night will be epic and in my mind, Thanksgiving come early. Signup now for what will be an amazing night filled with smiles, tacos and more smiles.


Note: I am planning to redo my sequence from La Palapa getting mature at their bar before heading to Empellon Al Pastor. I plan to be at La Palapa by 6pm to get my Happy Hour On! If you want to join me there before heading to Al Pastor let me know in the comments. Otherwise i will see you at Al Pastor at 7pm...ish.  ;)


Prepare For Greatness!

DeRM

What past participants have said about critiques:

Vickie gave us valuable feedback, and it was the feedback that we all needed. If you want to belong to a social and educational photo Meetup, try this one!”

“A very enjoyable evening. I learned a lot!”

“Great evening! It was good to see everyone and I enjoyed everyone's work. It very helpful to me get reactions from other folks to improve my pictures.

“So interesting to see how cropping can move a photo from good to wow! A thoroughly enjoyable evening. Thanks for such an enjoyable discussion.”

Great feedback! Great to see other photographer's work and viewpoints.

“All, thank you for a great experience and the great suggestions. I'm using them already and got many new ideas from all the wonderful photos.”

“As usual, I was impressed and inspired by everyone's photos. I also picked up a couple new tips, so it was a great night!”

“Thank you all for a wonderful evening! Beautiful photos, great tips and a great group! Hope to attend another informative session :)”


Learn to improve your photography through a gentle and honest interactive online photo critique led by two seasoned professional photographers. The very best way to take your photography to the next level is to get personal feedback. These critiques are a great place to feel safe, talk about your work and get constructive feedback from well-traveled professional photographers, Loren Fisher and Vickie Lewis.


Loren has been a professional photographer and photo editor since 1978. He is an adjunct professor at Rutgers University and sells his works at art shows and festivals throughout the East Coast.

Vickie has been a professional photographer and editor for over 30 years and has shot over 150 portraits for People Magazine. Her work is represented by The National Geographic image collection. Both Loren and Vickie love working with photographers of all levels and conduct workshops across the country.

To assure personal attention during the critiques, we limit the number of photographers being critiqued to six. Photographers being critiqued will be able to interact with both Vickie and Loren and get their questions answered. We’ve been doing critiques for a long time and realize that just listening can be educational too and so we are inviting all our Meetup group members to view the critiques for free.

The first six photographers who sign up to be critiqued will send 8-10 photos via email. Send your best, a recent shoot or something that didn't come out the way you thought it would and we'll help figure out what could have been done differently. Due to time limitations, we probably won’t critique all the photos each photographer submits, but we like to have a selection to look at to help you improve. We will make sure those who choose to participate get personal attention.

It doesn't matter what your skill level is, we have beginners and advanced and everyone learns something! We believe in gentle critiques where we assure that you learn something and feel good about your work when you are done.


If you’d like to have your photos critiqued, the price is $25 per person. Go to this link to sign up:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=DK43UWXT68PC6

results.description:
How often do we take the time to really focus on releasing all the tension and stress that we accumulate in our body?

Not very.

Instead, we just keep on trucking, hoping it all will magically disappear.

But we know that won't be the case unless we do something about it.

Enter Osho's powerful Kundalini meditation, a kind of active meditation specifically designed for modern life that helps us to release stress and unblock our energy.

Comprised of 15 minutes of shaking, 15 minutes of dancing, 15 minutes of stillness (sitting or standing), and 15 minutes of silence (shavasana), this meditation is a really amazing way to shake everything off, get past self-doubts and limiting beliefs.

Because it's both invigorating and relaxing, it gets us out of our mind and reminds us of how incredibly good being an embodied being can feel like when we get out of our way. 

This practice creates a release of pent up emotions, tension and blockages in the body, and it's energizing, uplifting and calming at the same time. It's often a really amazing way to make room for inspiration because once those doubts are removed, creativity flows like whoa!


Join us every other Tuesday as we shake it all off, and leave it on the floor.


Shake It All Off! Active Meditation for Tension Release and Well-Being

Tuesdays, November 10 and 24, and December 8 and 22

Location TBA (Manhattan)

$10 donation

Register


NOTE: in order to cover costs, this event requires at least 5 people to be signed up per date 24 hrs prior for it to happen. Please RSVP mindfully so I know what size room to book for us in advance.



---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


"After attending Melody’s “Shake It Off” and “Embodiment” workshops, not only was my personal way of relating to my physical, mental, and spiritual enhanced, but it motivated me to seek out entire aspects of the human condition that have supported my growth as a social worker deeply. Prior to working with Melody, I had been enamored with the mind and aspects of intelligence that caused me to completely disconnect from my body; I did not take care of it, and it did not take care of me. I feel so fortunate to have experientially learned with Melody’s guidance, that the body holds many of the keys to inner peace, whether for my self or my clients."

Abbi K., New York, NY


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

MELODY KIERSZ

Melody Kiersz wants you to stop trying to prove yourself worthy and start living the life that makes you happy.

Melody holds a degree in Happiness from the prestigious New York University, is a Certified Holistic Health Counselor graduated from the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, a member of the American Association of Drugless Practitioners, and a Certified Yoga Teacher through Jungle Yoga Ashram.

Melody is a deep listener and reads between the lines to guide you in discovering the ways you're holding yourself back from your true expression. She specializes in healing our relationship with our bodies, our selves and others, improving body image and self-esteem, increasing our ability to speak up, share, and allow ourselves to be seen and loved as we are. As the Founder of Naked Wellness, her goal is to guide you as you peel all those layers of resistance so you can turn yourself on for a life full of health, passion, power, freedom, joy and pleasure.

Based in New York City, Melody offers in-person and long-distance private sessions, and is really passionate about everyone really getting that they are absolutely perfect exactly as they are.

She can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

Please note this restaurant does not take reservations, which is why I am limiting the group size to 4

Menu:  http://www.kottuhouse.com/kottu_menu_040915.pdf


RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description:
http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/5/6/b/b/event_7042203.jpegCome join your peers from Westchester County and the surrounding areas (hello Bronx, Connecticut, Orange and Putnam Counties) in a lively, friendly, facilitated discussion group for men, women, genderqueer, transgender, and not-quite-sure people, as well as people who fall on different places along the monogamous to polyamorous dimension, as long as you inhabit the space between totally straight and totally gay somewhere (i.e., bisexual, bi-curious, questioning, queer, “I don’t label myself,” bi-friendly or some other non-monosexual identity).

People who wish to understand their bisexual loved ones are also welcome.

This group is for people over 18. It is NOT a hook-up group. As the name says, we meet to talk about bisexual issues. People whose behavior makes other group members uncomfortable will be asked to leave.

The group meets at The LOFT, the LGBTQ safe space in White Plains, Westchester County, New York at 7:30 PM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of every month.

Even if you can't always make it to the group meetings in person, please join us on line, ask questions, chat, make some "net-friends" and keep up with what is happening in the Westchester County and surrounding bisexual community.

results.description:
The word "innovation" gets tossed around blithely, but few people know how to use this concept to advance their goals. What makes something innovative? What is the formula for deciding whether something is innovative or not? How do you logically explain what makes one method better than another?

Doing your own analysis is only half the battle: next, you have to convince others that your analysis is correct. 

As it turns out, journalists and consultants have well-known formulas for assessing and explaining why one method yields better results. Incorporating these formulas into your everyday thinking will make your a more convincing, more effective human being, at work and life.

--- About Responsive Career Design ---

Deliberate career design can make people more productive, happier, and more successful—and it's the key to succeeding at the best companies to work for. In the future, the most fulfilling roles will only be available to people who know how to operate autonomously inside a new kind of self-organizing entity.

I first became interested in org design after writing this 8,000-word piece about Github for Fast Company. Since then, I've learned that many of the individuals at companies like Github have "org" strategies for their personal and creative lives, too.


As always, email me if you have questions ([masked]) and see you soon!

results.name: Formulas for analyzing and explaining "innovation"

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
10v10 pickup game, 65min+.. it's a chance to burn some before Thanksgiving! Be ready to start at 8:15pm at Field 3.

ALL players need to bring a white and black t-shirt and  ball.

It's a large field and some players may need the option to sub. If you're a dedicated goalkeeper let us know - Intermediate level.


****************************************************************

DETAILS:

• Played in a friendly environment. Pass the ball have fun.

• No rough tackles or play. Players are expected to bring a positive attitude, no screaming at/or berating team mates.

•  BRING A BALL. If you hit a ball into the river, you'll need to replace it!  If there aren't any dedicated goalkeepers playing, we rotate in goal every 5 mins.

• No metal cleats. Only turf or molded cleats.

• If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow, and it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


Payment goes toward field permit, equipment and fees.

See you at the pitch!


Note: The is a 2/3 regulation size field with full size goals. Not suitable for beginner level or inexperienced players.

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.
results.name: Tuesday 10v10 @8:15pm Pier 5, Brooklyn | 65min+ Full Size Goals

results.description:
Join us for a group call designed to facilitate the integration process after a medicine ceremony.
We will begin with a guided meditation, and offer time to:
-share our personal experiences,
-offer tools and exercises that can be done daily to assist the unfolding of what you experienced with the medicine,
-and answer any questions participants may have
*If you have any additional requests for things we can do together please let me know!
Guided by: Rachael Sessions

Intended for those who participated in the most recent ceremonies Nov 13 & 14 or in prior ceremonies (with this or another team).

Date: Tuesday November 24
Time: 830pm-10pm

This will take place via conference call, the number and code will be announced to registered participants 48 hours prior to the call.

By Donation (Suggested Exchange: $11 )

*The reason I am requesting a monetary exchange is to recognize the exchange of energy and time that happens in this work. As stated by the Universal Law of Giving and Receiving: when one Being seeks to receive from another Being, (s)he must not come empty-handed, lest (s)he leave empty-handed. The offering is simply a symbol of your desire to receive the intentions you have set for yourself and to engage in the exchange being offered to you. This offering also supports our growing community so we can continue to offer more enriching activities, meetings, and prayers. Just as I hope you will respect my time and energy offering, I respect your personal financial situation. If making this donation is in any way an issue for you, please communicate with me about it. I do not want the donation to be the reason why you are unable to participate.
results.name: After Ceremony Integration Community Call

Join us every Tuesday at 8:30pm as La Luz hosts an ALL LEVELS, OPEN,  DROP-IN Improv Comedy Class!!!

We begin the class with a focus on group activities and fun games as we  move towards some individual character building, short and long form scenes, listening, supporting our partner(s), and performing in front an audience.

Each week is a bit different with various teachers from Upright Citizens Brigade, Magnet Theater, the PIT and places all over the world! Every instructor is a new experience and want our students to have a dynamic well rounded learning experience.

Classes are donation based so please come anyway. We ask $10-13.

Now get on over to La Luz and Let’s Play!!!!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Our complete Fall 2015 Hike Schedule is available on the NJR ADK website at hudsonhikers.org. If there's a hike you'd like to join that's not posted here on Meetup, you may register directly with the hike leader using the contact information provided in the hike schedule.

*   *   *   *   *   *

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:  Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B-7-A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.
results.name: Fall 2015 Hike Schedule

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
Hello,

7v7 game, 90min+, bring a white & black tee-shirt.

Don't be late, we start on time!


This long running pick-up plays in Chinatown and has a storied history. The game has been going 12+ years, and was born by a group of Irish, English, Scottish and German expats who needed a mid-week footballing outlet. The group has now expanded to include players from around a dozen countries.

The group is looking for additional players to complement the game. The match is played in a sporting yet competitive spirit. This is for seasoned players - NO beginners please.

A good attitude, positional sense and a preference for passing is a must. We usually play for 1.5 hours year round.


Someone usually brings pinnies, but bring a white and black top just in case.

Note: RSVP is required to attend the game. There are a number of regulars who attend each week in addition to the meetup list - not all players are listed on the meetup.

See you there.
results.name: Chinatown Pick-up Wednesdays @12:00pm

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014 

"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2014 

“ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

It was enlightening!!! Every time I practice Bodhi meditation, it feels like my Chi increases more and more! Thank you everyone for sharing this to NYC." Javoski (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Nan emits healing energy -- the meditation is wonderful" Linda (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Very calming and energizing. I did not have any negative thoughts or worries last night in bed like I always do. I felt my mind was clear. I will definitely go to another class" Dee (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

-----------------------------------------------------------------


Thank you all for participating in your Bodhi Meditation class.

Between May 14,2013 and June 2015 over 3,000 people attended our classes in NYC, Westchester and Long Island.


Date: Wednesday

Time: 1:00 - 2:30pm

Class Price: FREE**


Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness

* Stronger emotional intelligence

* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated

* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America.

Feel free to ask Nan your personal health questions after the class.

Please arrive early for class intro/setup.

Class basic info:

* Loose fitting clothes is recommended but not required.

* Some people bring their own yoga mat for the seated meditation part. This is not a requirement as we have chairs for everyone.

* Cellphones needed to be turned off during the class.

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card. The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

Contact: [masked] Here is the internet link if you are interested in purchasing the meditation music.

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

results.description:
Come  enjoy a little Zen before the holiday frenzy begins! Warm up with an easy walk at one of Bergen Countys' best parks for walks and biking. Lets enjoy the milder weather while we can and burn some of those holiday calories! 

This will be about a 2 hour walk, covering approx. 5 1/2 miles  at a moderate pace on a paved, level path, that follows along the Saddle River where we were once lucky enough, to spot a red fox!  There is plenty of wildlife around if you take the time to look.  We will first pass by the dog runs to enjoy our furry 4 legged friends  and then pick up the trail nearer the exit to the park,   cross over a  bridge and  turn left at the "T"  to see the waterfall in the bend, then head to the pond at the Glenrock section of the park and then retrace our steps back to the parking lot.

ALWAYS KEEP TO THE RIGHT ON THESE SHARED PATHS TO ALLOW BICYCLISTS, SKATERS, ETC TO PASS SAFELY!

MEET AT THE BENCH BY THE FLAG POLE, IN FRONT OF THE CAMP SUNSHINE SNOWFLAKE BLDG. All you need are sneakers or good walking/hiking shoes or boots, depending upon the weather and trail conditions and don't forget your water.  Dress in layers for the changing weather and don't forget those cameras! Not for singles only.

DIRECTIONS: FROM ROCKLAND TAKE 17 SOUTH AND  TAKE THE PARAMUS RD EXIT AND HEAD TOWARD RIDGEWOOD.  TURN RT ON E. RIDGEWOOD AVE AND THE PARK ENTRANCE WILL BE ON YOUR RIGHT IN A SHORT DISTANCE.

Inclement weather cancels, always check the day of an event for possible changes.
results.how_to_find_us: By the bench, by the flag pole, in front of the Camp Snowflake Sunshine bldg.
results.name: PRE THANKSGIVING DAY WALK  AT THE SADDLE RIVER CNTY PARK WILD DUCK POND

group.name: Rockland Singles 50 Plus Afternoon Walks, Hikes, Arts & Ent.

Trekking the 4,000 foot peaks IN MAINE

HOUSE RENTED! -- Details below!  14 spots available! 

OUTDOOR HOT TUB 

Beginner events available

Downhill / x-country skiing

TACKLE AS MANY PEAKS AS YOU CAN or relax in the big Jacuzzi. 

Full Thanksgiving dinner included!

Everyone will be placed on the waiting list until I receive payment - The cost is listed below

COST: The below covers 4 nights accommodations and a full Thanksgiving dinner! 

Single person in a bed = $220

Two people sharing a bed = $380

Carpool available from Poughkeepsie Train Station 1:30pm Wednesday- $115

No refunds

The Rangeley-Stratton Area, bound by the communities of Rangeley, Kingfield, Stratton, and Phillips, contains nearly 21,000 acres of land above 2,700 feet and ten peaks reach elevations higher than 4,000 feet.

It is the HIGHEST CONCENTRATION OF HIGH PEAKS in the Longfellow Mountains. Extensive alpine tundra zones are found on Saddleback Mountain and The Horn, Mount Abraham, Sugarloaf, and Bigelow Mountain. Slightly less spectacular but still of interest to the peakbagger or AT enthusiast are the wooded 4,000-foot peaks of Crocker Mountain and Spaulding Mountain.

Drive up Wednesday night to Rangeley, Maine (7.5 hour drive from Poughkeepsie).

HIKE ANY OR ALL OF THE DAYS!

Drive home Sunday Afternoon

(no refunds).

Bigelow Range Loop

Crocker, South Crocker Mountains

Sugarloaf-Spaulding

Saddleback-Horn


Saddleback Mountain and The Horn


Mt. Abraham



NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas ...

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the HVH ABOUT page.

results.description:
The Empty Sky Memorial is the official New Jersey September 11th memorial to the state's victims of the September 11th attacks on the United States. It is located in Liberty State Park in Jersey City at the mouth of the Hudson River across from the World Trade Center Site. One cannot visit the memorial without being over whelmed by the historic events that occurred on Sept. 11, 2001 and the memorial erected to commemorate it.

It is an event and a memorial that touches us all.

On November 25th, 2015, AIP will lead a group of photographers to the memorial to photograph the memorial and to attempt to capture the spirit of  the memorial and the events leading up to it. 

Why November 25th? We have chosen this date because sunset will occur at 4:32 p.m. and a full moon will appear at 5:44. p.m. These astral events will add impact to our imagery.

Here are a few images taken by others that, in my humble opinion, do justice to the memorial:


Join us on November 25th and allow yourself to feel the moment. 

After our photo shoot, those who wish can adjourn to the Liberty House Restaurant with it's magnificent view of lower Manhattan and enjoy some fine food and drinks in the company of your fellow photographers. (Chimping allowed.)

Martin Joffe, Eric Dong, Boris Hardoiun-Deleuze

Your AIP Organizers

<a></a>
results.name: Empty Sky Memorial at Liberty State Park at Sunset and Moon Rise

results.description:
Wednesday, 11/25/2015 - Macy's Parade Balloon Inflation Tour from 3pm - 10pm

The Upper West Side comes to life the night before Thanksgiving! Join us for for The Giant Balloons of The Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade up close and personal! We will get to see the Macy's Giant Balloons get inflated along Central Park West. You will be so close you can almost touch them! This is an only in NY experience that you have to do at least once in your life!

Please note: This is more of a family experience than an actual meetup so if you come early and/or late and you don't connect with others...that's cool too!

*this event gets packed so earlier the better

*we will congregate from 4:10 - 4:20 on 84th and Columbus & head down to the viewing area together (if we try to meet by the viewing area it will be chaos)

*Feel free to bring wife/partner/family if you wish

*if you can't make it @ 4:15pm with the dads group, I recommend going in the evening with your family - an amazing experience

To get an idea of the experience. Here is an excerpt from a blog I found online from travel gal at timesunion.com... I’ve wanted to go to the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade Big Balloon Blow-Up ever since I saw a particularly funny episode on Seinfeld. As I remember it, on the night before Thanksgiving, Elaine is anxious to be invited to a popular party held at an apartment on Manhattan’s Central Park West. The party is held every year at that time, and it centers around the apartment’s great view of the balloons being inflated before the next day’s big parade. As you can expect from this comedy series, Elaine attends, things don’t go well, and at least one poor balloon loses its life. Horton at the Big Balloon Blow-Up Well, last year I got my wish when my family and I went down to see the event. We weren’t disappointed because this was a great experience. The Big Balloon Blow-Up is free, and it takes place on 77th and 81st streets between Central Park West and Columbus Avenue. Although there was a short barricade, we were able to get very close to the balloons that, usually, you’d only be able to see on TV. Pirate Balloon at the Big Balloon Blow-Up The Big Balloon Blow-Up takes place this year from 3pm to 10pm, but I’d recommend going earlier than later to avoid the growing crowds. When we were there, safety was good because it was basically a family event, and there were police officers all around.
results.how_to_find_us: on corner waiting to view the balloons
results.name: NYC Dads, Kids, & Family Enjoy the Macy's Parade Balloon Blow-Up

The Pioneer Shooting Center would like to invite you to Winchester Wednesdays, our weekly shooting event for the Winchester/NRA Marksman Qualification Program. Whether you just purchased your first pistol/rifle, new to shooting or are a seasoned shooter, the Winchester/NRA Marksman Qualification has something for everyone. This Program provides the perfect self-paced shooting activity to help develop your skills and reward your achievements. 

We offer two qualifications – Pistol* and Rimfire Rifle

No license required for Rifle Qualification

Rifle rental available or use your own

Self paced qualifying – Train at your own pace

Have your results posted in our lounge

Receive an award, rocker, and certificate for each level completed

Get nationally recognized when you achieve Distinguished Expert

Join Us Every Wednesday From 5:00PM – 9:00PM

Challenge Your Friends – No Reservations Required

Packages Start At $30.00  Plus Regular Lane Fee

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown every Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!  This week we will extend the hours and crank up the music later in the night for a special night before Thanksgiving Party!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...


-Food & Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!
results.name: 'Twas The Night Before Thanksgiving Party

group.name: The Best NYC Singles Parties & Social Events

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!
results.name: Thanksgiving Eve After Work Party ~`Free Event

group.name: New York Every Night (and Day) Social Events and Adventures

results.description:
From LetMyPeopleGo.com, the creators of The Ball on Dec 24 (https://www.facebook.com/jewishsinglesball/), the Nation's Biggest Jewish Singles Event for the past 20 years, comes the 21st Annual Turkey Ball!

For 21 years in a row, we've stuck our necks out and brought you one of the biggest Jewish Singles events of the year on Thanksgiving Eve!

This year's event will held at Hudson Terrace's enclosed, heated and gorgeous rooftop (Anytime you use the word rooftop in an event promotion, the word "gorgeous" must proceed it by operation of law, but it is a beautiful spot and, more importantly, a very comfortable venue for meeting new people).

Here's what you can expect:

• [masked] Jewish Singles, each of whom is more desirous of you than the next 

• 2-for-1 beer, wine and well drinks (6-7 pm) to ensure the veracity of the first bullet point

• A completely private event on Hudson Terrace Rooftop (6-10 pm). For four hours your cup shall runneth over with Jews of the available variety! 

• Amazing music from our top DJ and dancing that can sometimes can also be charitably described as amazing. 

• A potentially magical evening of mixing, mingling, dancing and romancing. 

Tickets are quickly gobbled up to this event, so be sure to reserve yours today at http://turkeyball2015.eventbrite.com.
results.name: 21st Annual Turkey Ball for Jewish Singles (20s, 30s, 40s)

results.name: Wednesday Sunset Yoga

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Thanksgiving Eve is the second biggest party night of the year - so join us at one of Manhattan's most beautiful rooftop venues! They're opening up the normally private Red Room to us and making it a dance party!

Date: Wednesday, November 25th  

Time: 6-10 PM

Dress: To Impress

Admission: FREE!

Location: Gansevoort Park Ave. Rooftop!

420 Park Ave. South (@ 29th street) 

* Drink Specials * 

 $8 red and white wine!

$6 draft beer!

Discounted vodka cocktails!

Party Earth says:

Fashionable patrons taking in the unobstructed view of the Empire State Building from this twentieth-floor hotspot will understand why Gansevoort Park Avenue Rooftop chose "always on top" as its motto.

Sleek and sexy, the space features floor-to-ceiling windows and plenty of sitting areas with suede sofas and wingbacks to accommodate the fashion-industry notables and upscale preppy partiers who gather to check each other out over bottle service.

Clutches of chic Europeans sipping expensive cocktails add just the right jet-set touch to an already swanky scene, complete with the requisite young professionals in tight t-shirts scoping out the beautiful ladies at the brown granite bar.

On warm nights, patrons flock to the spacious terrace to lounge on blue vinyl chaises by the illuminated pool, which features a mosaic of a vintage bathing beauty and is divided into indoor and outdoor sections, allowing guests to dip their toes in year round.

A narrow wraparound balcony bordering two sides of the venue features leather benches and glass floor panels with a dizzying view, while the private Blue Room one floor down offers a true VIP experience that includes exclusive sets spun by renowned DJs.

Stylish party-seekers looking for a combination of upscale vibe, breathtaking views, and a flirty clientele ready to mingle should definitely put this Park Avenue Rooftop on the top of the must-see list.
results.name: Thanksgiving Eve Dance Party at Gansevoort Park Rooftop (Free, Drink Specials)

results.name: Thanksgiving Eve Dance Party @ The Gansevoort Park Ave: Free Admission!

results.description:
Thanksgiving Eve is the second biggest party night of the year - so join us at one of Manhattan's most beautiful rooftop venues! They're opening up the normally private Red Room to us and making it a dance party!

Date: Wednesday, November 25th  

Time: 6-10 PM

Dress: To Impress

Admission: FREE!

Location: Gansevoort Park Ave. Rooftop!

420 Park Ave. South (@ 29th street) 

* Drink Specials * 

 $8 red and white wine!

$6 draft beer!

Discounted vodka cocktails!

Party Earth says:

Fashionable patrons taking in the unobstructed view of the Empire State Building from this twentieth-floor hotspot will understand why Gansevoort Park Avenue Rooftop chose "always on top" as its motto.

Sleek and sexy, the space features floor-to-ceiling windows and plenty of sitting areas with suede sofas and wingbacks to accommodate the fashion-industry notables and upscale preppy partiers who gather to check each other out over bottle service.

Clutches of chic Europeans sipping expensive cocktails add just the right jet-set touch to an already swanky scene, complete with the requisite young professionals in tight t-shirts scoping out the beautiful ladies at the brown granite bar.

On warm nights, patrons flock to the spacious terrace to lounge on blue vinyl chaises by the illuminated pool, which features a mosaic of a vintage bathing beauty and is divided into indoor and outdoor sections, allowing guests to dip their toes in year round.

A narrow wraparound balcony bordering two sides of the venue features leather benches and glass floor panels with a dizzying view, while the private Blue Room one floor down offers a true VIP experience that includes exclusive sets spun by renowned DJs.

Stylish party-seekers looking for a combination of upscale vibe, breathtaking views, and a flirty clientele ready to mingle should definitely put this Park Avenue Rooftop on the top of the must-see list.

This is a permanent placeholder for Dev4X General Update Video Hangout.

The meeting will take place Bi-Weekly. The purpose of this hangout is to have an open discussion and answer any questions. We usually kick off  the meeting with an update on what we have been doing in the previous 2 weeks and what we hope to accomplish in the following two weeks.

Here is the permanent video Hangout link for to attend this meeting: https://plus.google.com/hangouts/_/dev4x.com/dev4x-general?authuser=0

If you are not familiar with Dev4X, we invite you to learn more about us here: http://www.dev4x.com
