results.description:
iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.  

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Ultimaker 2

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance 


• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: How to 3D print with HyVision Cubicon

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown every Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!  This week we will extend the hours and crank up the music later in the night for a special night before Thanksgiving Party!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...


-Food & Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown every Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!  This week we will extend the hours and crank up the music later in the night for a special night before Thanksgiving Party!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...


-Food & Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.
results.name: FREE West African Dance Class!!

results.description:
Lets launch the long Thanksgiving weekend with a favorite band Mystic at the fun beirgarten......  Your hosts will be Joe (from the Summer beach parties) and myself....

Traditionally a great night for fun and celebration....join us with friends, family and meet someone new...

 Great ale carte German food items , burgers plus traditional choices on menu and of course the many beer and drink favorites.

Long Island's most popular cover band performing all of your favorite hits from yesterday and today. Performing at the hot...test spots in the Tri-State area .  Mystic plays all the favorites and touches on so many styles and artists .... From Rock , funk and dance favorites

Come down and celebrate good times ....you'll meet everyone ..

No Cover ....its free

Perdue the Turkey lady says .... and we second ....Holiday blessings and wish everyone good things health and happiness .....
results.name: Friendsgiving Holiday Weekend Launch Party Mingle w Mystic @ Platteduetche

Join us after work this Thanksgiving Eve and mingle with over 100 mature singles. We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20 somethings. That's why we've created this great event filled with more mature singles. Our events have been called "The Best Place To Meet Quality Singles In NYC". 

Get tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/thanksgiving-eve.html

• Free Light Appetizers (7-8pm)

• Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• 100+ singles in their 30s, 40s, 50s+ 

• Thanksgiving Ice Breakers & Prizes

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE: The organizers of this event have told us that this event is almost at capacity. Please register asap to confirm your spot.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT (ALSO A LOT OF SINGLES FROM OUTSIDE OF MEETUP WILL BE ATTENDING). THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS A VERY SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Nov 28 Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Event runs from 6:30-9:30pm

Join us after work this Thanksgiving Eve and mingle with over 100 mature singles. We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20 somethings. That's why we've created this great event filled with more mature singles. Our events have been called "The Best Place To Meet Quality Singles In NYC".

So what's a Click event? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone. At every Click event we set up fun ice breakers to get the party going (during which you can win prizes!) You can participate or just relax and mingle at your own pace.

  We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars amongst a bunch of early 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. This event is perfect for you! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone.

* Over 200 Single Professionals Attending!


* Drink Specials!


*  Icebreaker With Chances To Win Prizes!


* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling


* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)


* Suggested Age Range: Late 30's to 50's

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.

results.description:
Friends, for those of you not leaving NYC this Thanksgiving we'd like to invite you to a 'Friendsgiving' soccer fundraiser for Street Soccer USA. 

Street Soccer USA have the permit for Brooklyn Bridge Park Pier 5 on Wednesday November 25th, from 6-10pm. They would love to get some people down to play some friendly pick-up soccer, hang out and ultimately have a great start to a fantastic Thanksgiving Weekend.

3 teams of 10 players will play on a winner stays on type format. (if we get more than 30 signed up we will possibly change the format of the games)

So guys...sign up, invite your friends and let's play some friendly soccer!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be playing on the end field on Pier 5

results.description:
Event Name: Climb at BKB

Leader: Ed

Event Type: Wall indoor top rope and lead sport Climbing!!

Location: Brooklyn

Climbing Shoes, Harness and belay device are part of group discount $22.00.. Just mention you are part Northeast Hiking at front desk. Also look for us on the wall.

This venue is one of the best indoor rock climbing gyms on the east coast!

The walls range from beginner to expert difficulty, so there is something to climb for everyone. If you have ever wanted to try rock climbing for the first time, or if you're a pro, this is the place to do it! The gym runs 'climbing 101' classes which instruct on how to climb, tie the basic knots, belay fellow climbers, etc. Check out the gym's website.  Why not come out and meet/ climb with fellow members of the group?

http://brooklynboulders.com/brooklyn/

results.description:
Join us for Scrabble every Wednesday.  The first people usually arrive between 5:00 and 5:30, and the last people leave around 10:00.  Come any time.

We tend to play two-person games.  It's a friendly, low-key game with a range of skill levels.  Whatever people agree on in terms of dictionaries, challenges, and anything else is fine.  The main objective is to have fun.

Panera in Wayne is on Route 23 southbound, in the Brentwood Plaza (second driveway south of Ratzer Road).
results.name: Scrabble

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown every Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!  This week we will extend the hours and crank up the music later in the night for a special night before Thanksgiving Party!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...


-Food & Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!
results.name: 'Twas The Night Before Thanksgiving Party

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

All skill levels are encouraged to attend. Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).
results.how_to_find_us: High School on Center Blvd (aka Academy for Careers in Television and Film)  1-50 51st Ave, Long Island City, NY
results.name: Mens Indoor Pick-up Basketball in Long Island City

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Adreanna Limbach

Adreanna's first encounter with Buddhism was in a high school philosophy class where the discourses on The Heart Sutra rocked her worldview in an uncomfortable and exhilarating way.

Following a subsequent decade of flirtation with meditation, she found her home at The Interdependence Project in NYC, where she completed their year-long teacher training immersion, and continues to study, practice and teach alongside those who inspire her path. 

She’s taught meditation as a practical tool for clarity and resilience to corporate offices, middle school students, and served as a lead coordinator of the Meditation Working Group at Occupy Wall Street, bringing daily practice to the volunteers at Zuccotti Park in 2011. 

When she's not on the cushion, she serves as an Executive Coach at The Institute for Compassionate Leadership, a Student Coach at The Institute for Integrative Nutrition, and catalyzes women to rally their resources so that they can find more freedom in business + life in her private practice. Come say Hello to her at www.AdreannaLimbach.com.

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

results.description:
7pm: Cody Roux on Interactive Theorem Proving with Lean


The last decade has seen interactive theorem proving go from the ivory tower of theory to impressive applications, notably the Compcert certified C compiler [1] and the mechanized proof of the Feit-Thompson theorem whose proof is a daunting 200 pages of graduate mathematics [2]. It's tempting to hope that interactive theorem proving could become a mundane part of programming practice in industry, where designs are validated by computer-assisted proof rather than tests or manual review.


This talk will present a new ITP system called Lean [3], which is based on dependent type theory. It will also give an overview of the basics of interactive theorem proving, outlining the system design (contrasting it to programming language design) and showing concrete examples. First we will give an overview of the general approach and present some basic examples to help give a feel for the everyday practice of proving theorems. The second part of the talk will then contrast Lean with other ITP systems (such as Coq and Agda) and give some taste of the more advanced features of the system.

--

Cody Roux has a PhD in Type Theory from INRIA, and worked on elements of the Lean theorem prover while a Postdoc at CMU, particularly the elaborator. He is a co-author with Leonardo de Moura, Jeremy Avigad, and Soonho Kon of the paper "Elaboration in Dependent Type Theory" (http://arxiv.org/abs/1505.04324) which describes the elaboration algorithm used in Lean. He currently works for Draper Labs at Cambridge, MA.

[1] http://compcert.inria.fr/

[2] http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/news/features/gonthierproof-101112.aspx

[3] https://leanprover.github.io/about/
results.name: Cody Roux on Interactive theorem proving with Lean

results.description:
CMobileCom WAF is a cutting-edge new responsive web technology based on J2EE standards(including JSF and JPA) and jQuery Mobile.  It is not required to master these underlying technologies. With CMobileCom WAF which is object model full stack web application framework, we use Java API to develop responsive web applications without writing any tag pages and without knowing browsers and devices.  Web applications will be automatically responsive to all desktop and mobile devices with mobile touch optimized.  CMobileCom WAF will help developers improve productivity.

CMobileCom WAF can be configured as a multitenant cloud computing infrastructure on which application modules can be deployed and added to one or more subsystems.

The following topics will be covered:

• Desktop and mobile page layout

• Page container and dialog

• Entity and backing beans

• Property annotations and UI widgets

• Auto complete and entity navigation

• Entity manager and query builder

• Authentication and access control

• Object-oriented Ajax

• Charting and reporting

• Embedded objects

• Form design

• Module development

• Theming

• Subsystem and multitenant cloud

Welcome to this event! 

Speaker: Daxin Cheng (Creator of CMobileCom WAF)
results.name: CMobileCom WAF - Responsive Web Application Framework

group.name: Cloud Mobile Computing and Responsive Web Technology

Are you game for something new? Do you enjoy playing Board Games? Here is your chance to join up to 50 members in the ultimate smackdown of Board Game dominance. 

Tickets to our last one sold out quickly...so get yours today - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/boardgame/dates/Nov-25-2015_at_0700PM

We'll have up to 20 teams (2-3 players each) competing in Taboo, Charades and Pictionary. The top teams will then compete in a sudden death version of Jenga. Winning team takes all! Prizes include tickets to shows/events.

You can either come alone and be placed with a partner or you can sign up with a guest. It is not meant to be gender balanced or age/ethnic specific.  

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door): 

$15 for 1 ticket - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/boardgame/dates/Nov-25-2015_at_0700PM

$28 for 2 tickets (use discount code "2" at checkout)     

*RSVPing alone will not get you into this event. You must also purchase a ticket in advance (NO tix will be sold at door). 

Multiple Meetup groups are co-organizing so don't just go by the RSVPs you see here. Up to 50 members attending. 

Get tickets at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/boardgame/dates/Nov-25-2015_at_0700PM

results.description:
To CJK Experts and Native Speakers:

We practice like this (including, but not limited to):

Session 1 (7pm-8pm): Interpretation methods practice

For example, words, phrases or sentences interpretation, target language repeating, shadowing and summarization, etc.

We set two tables to practice Chinese and Korean separately (Japanese is on hiatus due to low membership). The session is basically for intermediate & above Chinese and Korean learners.

Session 2 (8pm-9pm): Topic-based speaking practice

Summary, speak or discuss the topic you are provided or you have prepared by your target language (Chinese & Korean).

Also, everybody can move to any table as they want.

If you would like to practice English, please join our regular Saturday meetup generously hosted by Carl.

Looking forward to practicing with you all!

Organizers

results.description:
EVERY Wednesday Night!

New York City's hottest open mic in the heart of Queens' cultural mecca and in the homiest underground spot around - one level downstairs in the Q4 Hotel in Long Island City.

Produced by the long-running independent performance series, The Inspired Word (http://inspiredwordnyc.com), which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO Def Poetry stars, this open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - musicians, comedians, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, storytellers, performance artists, dancers, etc.

20 performance slots, 6-minute time limit for anything spoken, 7 minutes for anything musical. **Note to musicians: If you have backing tracks, bring them on an mp3 player or smartphone. Note to piano/keyboard players: You must bring your own keyboard.**

We are dedicated to celebrating the best of Queens' performing arts and developing a warm local artistic community. 

NO AGE RESTRICTIONS.

*****

When: Every Wednesday Night

Where: Q4 Hotel
http://www.q4hotel.com/

29-09 Queens Plaza N.
Long Island City, NYC

Time: 7pm sharp

Admission: $7 online for solo performer or audience member, $10 at the door

This is a very popular open mic. You can pay online or at the door, but we STRONGLY suggest you purchase a ticket in advance to guarantee a performance slot.

*****

By subway, take the E to Queens Plaza, N/Q/7 to Queensboro Plaza.

results.description: Come to our purely positive séance where we encourage mystics, psychics, mediums and all people to enhance their spiritual awareness in a safe and empowering environment. All of our séance conductors are highly trained and renowned mediums. Whether you are looking to connect with a loved one who has recently passed or to receive messages from spirit, our group offers a warm and friendly environment to all who are interested. Before each séance we begin our group with a 15 minute lesson on psychic development, covering topics from psychic impressions to spirit communication. We then begin our séance with a nondenominational prayer of protection and lead a guided visual mediation. After the meditation each person who attends will receive a message from one of our highly trained séance conductors. All participants are guaranteed to receive a message. Our group meets for approximately 2 hours. The purpose of our séance is to communicate directly with spirit and to form an open and inviting spiritual community in New York City Our meeting times are every other Wednesday Night at 7:00pm and our fee is $20. Please be timely, because we do not open our doors once we begin our meditation (for obvious reasons :). For legal purposes it is understood that our group and the messages given at our séances are for entertainment purposes only.
results.name: Seance in The City Meetup

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Full title: Interactive Panel - Global macro markets discussion

Abstract: With markets in flux looking towards a Fed hike in the coming months, and the large sell off in emerging markets, our expert panel will discuss how markets are behaving and also will be giving their views for macro markets, in particular for FX and rates. 

We will follow the event with drinks in the bar which should provide a great opportunity to network.

Speakers:

Our expert panelists will include:

• Eric Burroughs (Reuters - Editor of FX Buzz @ericbeebo)


• Mark Cudmore (Bloomberg News - First Word EM Strategist)

• Mick Grady (Aviva - Senior Economist/Multi-asset Strategist @fundamentalmac)

• Ashraf Laidi (Intermarket Strategy @alaidi)

• Jeremy Wilkinson-Smith (Independent FX trader @JeremyWS) 

• Saeed Amen (co-founder and managing director of the Thalesians @thalesians) will host the panel

Selected Bios

Eric Burroughs (@ericbeebo) is editor and managing analyst of Reuters Buzz, the intraday market intelligence and commentary service. Has covered markets and economics around the world for 15 years with Reuters, including stints in New York, Tokyo and Hong Kong where he previously served as Asia Financial Markets Editor.

Mark Cudmore recently joined Bloomberg as an Emerging Market Strategist, focusing predominantly on the CEEMEA region and with FX as a core product focus. He has spent over a decade in financial markets, mainly as an EM FX sell-side trader but also has worked in sales and on the buy-side. Mark graduated from Trinity College Dublin with a first class honours degree in Mathematics and Economics. 

Mick Grady (@fundamentalmac) recently joined Aviva Investors as Senior Economist and Multi-asset Strategist, responsible for global macro markets. Previously he was Senior Economist at COMAC Capital, a global macro hedge fund, following over a decade in a variety of roles at the Bank of England. He began his career in Australia as an economist at the Treasury department. He holds an Honours degree in Economics (Macquarie University Australia).


Jeremy Wilkinson-Smith (@JeremyWS) is an independent trader. He has spent the 5 years, trading FX and interest rates from a global macro perspective. He is currently reading finance at the University of Warwick. 

Saeed Amen (@thalesians) is a managing director and co-founder of the Thalesians. He has a decade of experience creating and successfully running systematic trading models at Lehman Brothers, Nomura and now at the Thalesians. Independently, he runs a systematic trading model with proprietary capital. He is the author of Trading Thalesians – What the ancient world can teach us about trading today (Palgrave Macmillan). He graduated with a first class honours master’s degree from Imperial College in Mathematics & Computer Science.
results.name: Panel (London) - Global macro markets discussion

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

results.description:
The Place: Compact, brick-walled Sri Lankan eatery offering chopped roti dishes at different spice levels.

Please note this restaurant does not take reservations, which is why I am limiting the group size to 4

Menu:  http://www.kottuhouse.com/kottu_menu_040915.pdf


RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON New York City

venue.address_1: 257 West 39th St. 14th Floor (Check the white board for "Steve" or ask the front desk)
venue.name: Champion Studios

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8-10pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.how_to_find_us: 39th street between 7th & 8th ave (closer to 8th ave).   This is Champion Studios.

Bare! True Stories of Sex, Desire and Romance brings together storytellers, comedians, sex educators and others to share true tales from their own experiences of sex, desire and romance. With stories as diverse as the people telling them, Bare! opens doors to bedrooms, back seats and dungeons to tell what your mama left out about the birds, bees and in-betweens.

Hosted by Jefferson (One Life Take Two)

Katie Fay Behrmann

Tea Hacic-Viahovic

Tommy O’Malley

Musical guest Afterbirth Monkey

. . . and you! Put your name in the hat for a chance to bare all on the Bare! stage.

Jefferson is the curator and host of Bare!, monthly in Boston, New York, Philadelphia and Washington, D.C. A sex educator and writer, Jefferson keeps a pseudonymous blog, One Life, Take Two, that details his life as a parent and pervert. He is a storyteller frequently seen on stages around New York and elsewhere, including The Moth, where he is a StorySLAM winner. He is also host of Foreplay! A Sexy Storytelling Open Mic, weekly in New York.

Email and mailing list [masked] Bare! True Stories of Sex, Desire and Romance appears regularly in Boston, New York, Philadelphia and Washington, D.C. Try your hand at sexy storytelling at Foreplay! A Sexy Storytelling Open Mic, weekly in New York at The Delancey.

You may also visit our FetLife (https://fetlife.com/events/398839) and Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/events/896003960480875/) pages.

When registering or checking in, please let us know you heard about the event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup.

results.description:
Thanksgiving Eve is known as the biggest party night of the year in New York City. Join us and over 200 singles at our Thanksgiving Eve Singles Party! With music and dancing, fun ice breakers, complimentary appetizers, a cash bar, and fun prizes, our party will be the best party of the night! You won't want to miss it!

What to expect: 

• Over 200 Singles

• Drink specials: $6 well drinks, $6 beers, $8 wines

• Ice Breakers

• DJ & Dancing

• Giveaways

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Price: $15 with RSVP, or $40 at door without RSVP if space allows.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


What are the recommended ages?

Women 21-45, Men 23-45

Is this event private? 

The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event.This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 200+ members attending.

results.description:
Eric Vega Productions invites you to Casino night at The Empire Hotel Rooftop Wednesday November 25th, the day before Thanksgiving  (HOLIDAY). MENTION ERIC VEGA at the door you will get a stamp for 1 hour of free drinks by Absolute Vodka from 10-11pm. We will also have blackjack and roulette tables with dealers at each table. These games are also 100% FREE to play. Win and redeem your chips for prizes such as free drinks, free vodka or Champagne bottles, tickets to the movies, tickets to NBA games and more.  We have had Casino night many times before and found that it is a great way to have some fun, unwind and meet great people with ease. Music by Rick Roc and Frank Roth. 

We hope to see you there. The Empire Hotel, 44 W 63rd St, Between Broadway and Columbus. Across from Lincoln Center. 

Hope to see everyone there. Must be over 21 WITH ID. No sneakers. Invite all your friends. Free admission and free to play Casino games all NIGHT! 

Eric Vega

Music by Rick Roc and Frank Roth. 

We hope to see you there. The Empire Hotel, 44 W 63rd St, Between Broadway and Columbus. Across from Lincoln Center. 

Hope to see everyone there. Must be over 21 WITH ID. No sneakers. Invite all your friends. Free admission and free to play Casino games all NIGHT!

Eric Vega

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE

We’re holding it down, for a very special Thanksgiving party at Studio Square. Drinks, food, and 3 DJs spinning at the same time to keep you singing and partying all night…Don’t like what DJ 1 is playing, you’ll have two other choices to dance and have fun to.

Your 3 DJs will be spinning:
DJ 1 (Green): Top 40 hits, Dance, Pop, etc
DJ 2 (Red): The best of 80’s & 90’s, and 2K music!
DJ 3 (Blue): Hip-Hop, R&B

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: Thanksgiving Quiet Clubbing @ Studio Square!

results.description:
Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation:

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

Wishing you all a very Happy Thanksgiving!

In keeping with our annual tradition, if you are unable to be with your family for this holiday weekend, we invite you to share Thanksgiving Liturgy with us at Holy Trinity Cathedral followed by a group lunch in Astoria: 

9AM: Thanksgiving Liturgy @ Holy Trinity Cathedral

11AM: Travel to Astoria for a Group Lunch @ Jimbo's Greek Restaurant (meeting up there at 12pm) 

Please register online: https://nycthanksgivingparea.eventbrite.com. There is no cost to register, but each person is responsible to pay for their lunch at the restaurant.

The Prix Fixe Lunch is $23.95 (without tax/tip) for turkey dinner with various sides, wine/beverage, dessert, and coffee/tea. A La Carte options are also available for those who prefer a smaller meal. 

Please RSVP by 12pm WEDNESDAY 11/25/15 for the group lunch so we are certain to have enough space for everyone! 

ALL ARE WELCOME. PASS IT ON!

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
Come out and work off some of those Thanksgiving calories before you consume them with a morning hike!  


Leader: Pat Horsch, cell day of hike[masked]

Meet: 9:30 AM at Trailside Nature Center parking lot on Coles Ave. 
Plan to arrive 15 minutes early to sign in, since we leave at 9:30. 
We will do a 4- to 5-mile hike on leader’s choice of trails, approx. 2 hours, finishing before noon.  Sturdy hiking shoes required, bring water. Steady rain cancels. Watch this site on the morning of November 26 for any last minute changes/cancellations.

DIRECTIONS:
Trailside Nature Center, Coordinates: N40° 40.97', W74° 22.38'
1.1. FROM LIVINGSTON: Take John F. Kennedy Parkway past the Short Hills Mall keep left, following signs
to SUMMIT and River Rd. Proceed 0.5 miles at light by Novartis, turn left onto Morris Ave. Continue 1.9 miles past Overlook Hospital as road bends to left. After passing the hospital, take the first right onto Glenside Ave. then in 0.1 miles bear left onto Baltusrol Rd (signs says US 22) road name changes to Summit Rd. After 1.1 miles, at light, turn right onto Summit Lane. At traffic circle, take the second right and proceed 0.5 miles further to a right turn onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.
1.2. ALTERNATIVE: VIA US ROUTE 22: Take Mountainside/New Providence Rd. exit (turn right from westbound lanes; jug-handle from eastbound lanes). Proceed uphill northwest bound for 0.7 miles (name changes to Deer Path) to the 5th right onto Ackerman Ave. In 0.4 miles at Tee intersection, turn right onto Coles Ave. Proceed 0.2 miles to Trailside Nature & Science Center parking lot on the left.
1.3. ALTERNATIVE: VIA I-78 EAST: Take Exit 44 (New Providence/Berkeley Heights). At light turn left onto Glenside Ave. Go 1.3 miles and turn right into the Watchung Reservation (CR 645 - W.R. Tracey Dr). Proceed past Lake Surprise, uphill and straight past loop picnic area. Bear left and continue 1.3 miles to traffic circle. At traffic circle take the first right and proceed 0.5 mile on Summit Lane. Turn right onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.

If this is your third meetup event with TSR we kindly ask that you join the club for $15 yearly membership with full access to our schedule which allows you to attend hikes and other outings 6 days a week. As a dues paying member of TSR you do not need to sign up for events and you do not have to be entered onto a waiting list. You can attend all events. Visit our website at tsr.nynjtc.org for an application and schedule preview.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at Trailside Nature Center Parking Lot
results.name: HIKE - Watchung Reservation, Mountainside, NJ
3 spots open - Soccer for fun @ 10AM

results.description:
THE GAME: Informal Meet Up 7vs7 

This game is ideally for INTERMEDIATE to ADVANCED players,NOT for BEGINNERS. Please bring GOOD ATTITUDE.  

RSVP GUIDELINES: IMPORTANT:  You must be on the RSVP list to play. If you are not. If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be removed from the group for 4 weeks.

PLAY GUIDELINES:

• We usually play for 90 - 120 minutes. with a short water break half time in. Please don't come if you can't play at least 90 minutes

• We play with 6 feet wide pop-up goals 

• No slide tackles. Turf shoes are suggested.

• Respect your teammates and opponents. 

RECOMMENDED GEAR - Turf shoes and no shinguards necessary

ABOUT THE FIELD - We always play on Turf fields

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**: Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.name: Thanksgiving 2015 morning soccer

results.description:
We'll meet at 10:00am Thanksgiving morning for a 3ish mile light run in the hood(s). This is not a race! Just our usual casual run, to burn a few calories before the day gets going. If you like, stick around to sing Happy Birthday to Ms. Ethel Plimack in Sunnyside, who is turning 105. There will be a neighborhood pop-up gathering in front of her home on 46th Street at noon. We are encouraged to bring a red rose or red balloon.


This will be a very casual pace run - in other words, all are welcome to participate, and nobody will be left behind. 

We may wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we could wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt. 

- - - - - - 

Please see our full calendar of events 

http://www.woodsidesunnysiderunners.com/events/calendar/

connect with us on Google+ 

http://www.google.com/+WoodsideSunnysideRunners

like us on Facebook 

https://www.facebook.com/WoodsideSunnysideRunners

https://instagram.com/woodsidesunnysiderunners/

results.description:
“THE ‘GIVE’ IN THANKSGIVING”

You are invited to join us for this beautiful time of experiencing the profound spiritual message of Thanksgiving and its uplifting and fulfilling influence in your life. This special service is an opportunity to enter into the spirit of the Thanksgiving holiday and begin the holiday season on a “spiritual note.” There will a time to meditate upon and give thanks for our blessings and a message on how a consciousness of giving in gratitude and appreciation increases our good.

Presented on a love offering basis.

results.description:
It has long been a tradition for our group to organize a Meetup on Thanksgiving Day, for those of us who are in the city without their family over the holiday.

We also warmly invite those who may be going later in the day to their family celebrations, to start their Thanksgiving Day with fellow vegetarians and vegans.

Our Vegetarian & Vegan Meetup group seldom gets to the excellent VP2 (Vegetarian's Paradise 2), and it is a treat for us to be going there on Thanksgiving.

Click here for VP2's very large, all-vegetarian menu -- including delicious sides like garlic mashed potatoes and cornbread stuffing, and many fresh vegetable juices, fruit juices, smoothies, frozen drinks, teas, sodas and delicious desserts (including cakes from Vegan Treats). VP2 will also additionally have a special Thanksgiving menu for us to order from.


**Please arrive promptly at 12 noon. There will be one seating only. Due to the large number of people arriving at one time, you may have to wait a bit for your food - please be patient. Everyone pays for their own meal.**

New York Magazine raves about VP2: "With ultra-reasonable prices and health-conscious twists on Chinese and Thai favorites, VP2’s well worthy of a pilgrimage for any student of vegetarianism. The tofu is light and creamy, and soy protein, wheat gluten, and sucanat are coaxed into a generally convincing array of mock meat and fish items. Skeptical carnivores will find it hard to resist the trademarked house special, crispy soul chicken: hunks of moist soy “chicken” breaded with rosemary, oregano, and basil."

For those of you who have never attended one of our Meetup events: this is an incredibly friendly & welcoming group. We'll be taking over the entire restaurant, so every diner you see will be part of our large group. Everyone pays for their own meal. Easy!

** Please arrive promptly at 12 noon. There will be one seating only. Due to the large number of people arriving at one time, you may have to wait a bit for your food - please be patient. Everyone pays for their own meal. **

Train Directions: A, B, C, D, E, F & M Trains to West 4th St.-Washington Sq.

Please RSVP for one Thanksgiving venue only. Please do not RSVP at two Thanksgiving venues to hold a spot at an additional venue.


Looking forward to see you on Thanksgiving for a delicious lunch with our wonderful vegetarian and vegan members.

David
results.how_to_find_us: Our meetup group will be taking over the entire restaurant.
results.name: Vegetarian/Vegan Thanksgiving Lunch at Vegetarian's Paradise 2 - Venue #1

results.description:
It has long been a tradition for our group to organize a Meetup on Thanksgiving Day, for those of us who are in the city without their family over the holiday.

We also warmly invite those who may be going later in the day to their family celebrations, to start their Thanksgiving Day with fellow vegetarians and vegans.

Red Bamboo is one of the most highly regarded vegetarian restaurants in New York and it is one of my personal favorites. They have a large and delectable all-vegetarian menu, and their prices are quite reasonable. Click here for Red Bamboo's extensive vegetarian (mostly vegan) menu.

**Please arrive promptly at 12:30pm. There will be one seating only. Everyone pays for their own meal.**

Zagat says "With an all-vegan menu straddling soul food and Pan-Asian cuisines, this Villager specializes in clever, so convincing mock versions of meat and fish dishes, from 'kickin' Creole chicken to Thai beef curry; the no-frills setting is matched with affordable tabs." [Note from David: their menu is not 100% vegan, but it is mostly vegan, and 100% vegetarian.]

We will be meeting outside Red Bamboo at 12:30pm to be among those entering through their doors at 12:30pm when the restaurant opens. Red Bamboo does not take any reservations from any person or group, but every year we go there at 12:30pm on Thanksgiving Day when they open. Red Bamboo has graciously taken a "semi-official" reservation from us, as they do every year -- we have told them we are coming and they are expecting us.

For those of you who have never attended one of our Meetup events: this is an incredibly friendly & welcoming group. We'll be meeting right outside Red Bamboo at 12:30pm (don't be late), and then walking in as a group when the restaurant opens at 12:30pm. Everyone pays for their own meal. Easy!

**Please arrive promptly at 12:30pm. There will be one seating only. Everyone pays for their own meal.**


Train Directions: A, B, C, D, E, F & M Trains to West 4th St.-Washington Sq.

Please RSVP for one Thanksgiving venue only. Please do not RSVP at two Thanksgiving venues to hold a spot at an additional venue.


Looking forward to see you on Thanksgiving for a delicious lunch with our wonderful vegetarian and vegan members.

David
results.how_to_find_us: Please arrive promptly at 12:30pm. There will be one seating only. We will be meeting as a group outside the restaurant, and then entering as a group when their doors open at 12:30pm.

results.description:
This trip has SOLD OUT. Join our Dec 18th-20th Killington trip.

Black Friday is our first ski/ride day of the season. Let's #OptOutside!

New 2015/2016 season, buy 10 day trips and get 1 day trip free, buy 20 get 2 free, etc. Weekend trip counts as 2 day trips. Once you accumulated 10 trips, let me know which day trip you want to join, & I will sign you up. :)

Ski season starts early at Killington, and they will open for a ride next Friday 10/31 (earliest in the east coast). Killington is one of the best ski resort at making snow. 

Check out our Killington Weekend Trips from previous season

1st Annual Thanksgiving Ski/Snowboard Trip @ Killington
http://www.nycaaa.com/events/86890432/
2nd Annual Thanksgiving Ski/Snowboard Trip @ Killington
http://www.nyskiclub.com/events/147308402/
3rd  Annual Thanksgiving Ski/Snowboard Trip @ Killington
http://www.nyskiclub.com/events/215301462/


We are going to Killington - the biggest & best ski resort in NorthEast. For this trip, we will stay at Comfort Inn in Rutland. We will also have a MBenz Sprinter van so everyone can relate and avoid 5 hours-long drive. Three hot breakfasts are included. Check out the similar trip to Killington & stay at Comfort Inn we had last ski season, with multiple 5 stars rating.

For this trip, we will stay at Comfort Inn in Rutland. We will also have a MBenz Sprinter van so everyone can relate and avoid 5 hours-long drive. Three hot breakfasts are included. Check out the similar trip to Killington & stay at Comfort Inn we had last ski season, with multiple 5 stars rating.


All rooms feature micro-wave refrigerators, 32" Flat Screen TVs, Coffee/Tea maker, Hair Dryer, Iron/Ironing Board, Radio Alarm Clock. 

New This 2015/2016 Season:  
* Room Renovations are 100% Complete!  
* All Guest Rooms- new EVERYTHING!! 
* New Lobby -Completed- New Guest Computer Room

Note: Trip plan email will be sent out to everyone confirmed (including those paid by Chase Quickpay) via Eventbrite 2 to 3 days before the departure date providing trip logistics and details.


Depart Date: November 26th Thursday 1:00 PM; please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 1:00 PM: (Garden City Deli) Corner of 43rd St and 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 1:45 PM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel) [masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map).

Return: Depart from Killington Ski Resort at 3:30 pm on 11/29 Sunday and expect to arrive at midtown NYC around 9:30 pm & Flushing at 10:00 pm

Hot Breakfast (Included): Eggs, Sausage, Toasting Breads, Belgium Waffles w/syrup, Bagels/Cream Cheese, Hot and Cold Breakfast Cereals, Yogurt, Bananas, Apples, Oranges, Breakfast Pastries, Juices, Tea, Hot Chocolate, Coffee, Milk

Trip Includes: 3 days 3 nights ski/snowboard trip; 3 nights accommodation at Comfort Inn Rutland. 3 days all mountain lift tickets at Killington. Benz Sprinter van or car round trip transportation from NYC, daily transportation between hotel & ski resort, tolls, & parking fee if any. 3 daily hot breakfasts.

Cost (The price is really good considering this is holiday weekend):
E. Birds - Own Queen Bed (Double Occup.) $359 for 1st 8 spots
E. Birds - Own Room (Single Occup.) $479 for 1st 8 spots
Regular - Own Queen Bed (Double Occup.) $379 for last 8 spots 
Regular - Own Room (Single Occup.) $499 for last 8 spots

Buy Ticket Here: http://nov2015killington.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until you have prepaid the ticket.

Note: Individual Queen Bed (Double Occupancy) = 2 persons in a two Queen beds room. Individual Room (Single Occupancy) = 1 person in a room

Additional Cost: 3 day equipment rental (skis or snowboard) is at group rate $90 (regular $120). $20 for 3 day helmet rental. $100 to upgrade 3 day lift tickets to 3 days Learn to Ski or Ride (lower mountain lift tickets, ski or snowboard rental & beginner group lesson)

Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $20 processing fee if cancelled 21 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 10 days in advance;
* No refund for cancellation or no show within 10 days; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $20 processing fee.

Video: 2012 Killington Thanksgiving Ski Snowboard Trip Group Run

http://youtu.be/xkMGHrLEX-U

http://youtu.be/xkMGHrLEX-U

Pictures from Previous Events:
2012: http://www.nycaaa.com/photos/11911972/
2013: http://www.nyskiclub.com/photos/18886532/
2014: http://www.nyskiclub.com/photos/25762700/

CHECK OUT ALL 2015/2016 TRIPS:
FB: https://www.facebook.com/nyskiclub/events
Meetup: http://www.nyskiclub.com/events
Eventbrite: https://nyskiclub.eventbrite.com

By RSVP'ing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NY Ski & Snowboard Club.

https://www.facebook.com/nyskiclub

Like our Facebook page, and get updated promotions/discounts.

results.description:
Are you new to a city or visiting from out of town? Or perhaps you are from the city, and have decided to not travel to see friends and family. Thanksgiving might feel a bit lonely; same if your family is far away.


At this time of Thanksgiving, we pause and count our blessings.
The freedom and opportunity for achievement this great country we live in offers .


So, come and celebrate Thanksgiving with a fun group of people!
It wouldn't be fall without the joy that comes from being with friends.

- Prix Fix Lunch Menu

- Ice Breakers

- Music

-Drinks

-Football Game and more!


Last year's Thanksgiving event attracted over 100 members.

There is no cover charge for this event.


This is a great opportunity where people can connect and become friends.

We have something planned for you every night throughout the Thanksgiving weekend!

Feel free to invite your friends, colleagues & classmates.

Let's all make this an enjoyable Thanksgiving!


Cheers,

Meetup Organizer

Rory

It has long been a tradition for our group to organize a Meetup on Thanksgiving Day, for those of us who are in the city without their family over the holiday.

We also warmly invite those who may be going later in the day to their family celebrations, to start their Thanksgiving Day with fellow vegetarians and vegans.

Peacefood Café Downtown is the newer, sister restaurant of the very popular Peacefood Café UWS. It's bigger & more comfortable at nearly twice the size, easy to get to, and has the same excellent food as the UWS Peacefood Cafe. Whether you've been here before or it is your first time, join us on Thanksgiving for a delectable lunch and wonderful company at Peacefood Café Downtown.

For Thanksgiving, Peacefood Cafe Downtown has a special Thanksgiving Menu. It features two starters: Chestnut Apple Bisque ($9) or Cashew Mushroom Pate ($12.95). If you are looking for a full meal, you can order any one of three entrees for $28. These "entrees" are actually all full meals, and come with all of the following (all included): Homemade Stuffing, Porcini Mushroom Gravy, Mashed Creamy Asian Purple Potato, and Sauteed Broccoli Rabe with Garlic & Lemon. Your choice of any of the following three entrees comes with all of the above, all for the $28 full-meal price: Pan-Seared Lemon Pepper Turkey Un-Cutlet, Peaceloving Lentil Loaf, or Roasted Winter Roots and Vegetables. But if you don't need a full meal or are going to eat with family later, feel free to just order a starter. Only the Thanksgiving Menu will be served on Thanksgiving, it is the first page here.

**Please arrive promptly at 1:00pm. There will be one seating only. Everyone pays for their own meal.**


NYCGo.com lists Peacefood Café as one of NYC’s healthiest restaurants.  "Trying to change your relationship with food? This is a good place to start. Indian-spiced chickpea fries are a swell snack, as are the pan-seared mushroom and chive dumplings with ginger-balsamic dipping sauce. … The many facets of each dish breed indifference to animal protein. They do the same thing for refined sugar, especially when it comes to raw cacao mousse pie in a walnut-coconut-date crust. "

New York Magazine's take on Peacefood, "Vegan cafe/diner combo promises to please all but the most devoted carnivore." CBS New York rates it as one of the 10 best restaurants for Vegetarians in NYC: "At this elegant upscale vegan bakery and cafe, baked goods are made with spelt instead of flour. Even their vegan Caesar salad has spelt croutons. The chocolate chip cookie sandwich has a oozy-chocolate pudding like center in the middle of two crispy spelt cookies. Or try the grasshopper variety with a tangy mint filling."

Indeed, Peacefood is also known for their extensive and heavenly dessert menu, including tiramisu,cheesecake, macaroons, brownies, key lime pie, strawberry shortcake, and chocolate chip cookie sandwiches. The Culinary Society of Columbia University says: “Many of the desserts vegans must constantly deprive themselves of were there: cupcakes, tiramisu, and brownies. We ordered both the tiramisu and a cinnamon bun; we were both amazed on how identical each tasted to its dairy filled alternative."

Blackbookmag.com writes:"Chickpea fries, fluffy quinoa salad, cardamom-coconut-banana shakes, roasted squash, raw cocao mousse pie - healthy, invigorating flavors and ingredients are a hit at this vegan cafe/bakery right by Union Square, peacefood's second location. Flanked with long front windows, red and black chairs, an ocean-inspired, soothing atmosphere - peace is exactly what you get here. And peace from the neverending food-guilt that stands after you gorge on cheesy nachos and burgers. Dining out - healthfully. It exists."

The Food Duo writes “Grasshopper Sandwich Cookie: Like a "gourmet" chocolate-peppermint whoopie pie!"

For those of you who have never attended one of our Meetup events: this is an incredibly friendly & welcoming group. We'll be meeting right outside Peacefood Cafe at 1:00pm, and then walking in as a group when the restaurant opens at 1:00pm. Everyone pays for their own meal. Easy!

**Please arrive promptly at 1:00pm. There will be one seating only. Everyone pays for their own meal.**

Train Directions: Take the L, N, Q, R, 4, 5 & 6 Trains to Union Sq. 14th St. Or, take the A, B, C, D, E, F & M Trains to West 4th St.-Washington Sq. (and leave the W. 4th St. station via the W. 8th St. exit).

Please RSVP for one Thanksgiving venue only. Please do not RSVP at two or more Thanksgiving venues to hold a spot at additional venues.


Looking forward to see you on Thanksgiving for a delicious lunch with our wonderful vegetarian and vegan members.

Eddie and David

results.description:
The yearly Thanksgiving day pick-up game. Come out and work up an appetite before you stuff your face.


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 1:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet on field 8.
