results.description:
The Brooklyn Ark Community Thanksgiving Potluck is for anyone looking for a fun and relaxed place to celebrate Thanksgiving. The Brooklyn Ark Community is made up of a diverse group of people, many of which are from out-of-town or out-of-country, and we don't think anyone should celebrate this holiday in a restaurant, but rather with a group of people as close to family as you can get. If you'll be in town this Thanksgiving, and are looking for a place to celebrate, invite your friends and RSVP on Facebook!


PLEASE BRING
This meal is potluck style, so please bring a side-dish, dessert, salad, etc. to share with the group. It doesn't have to homemade, feel free to grab something ready-to-go from your local grocery store if you want. Food Ideas to bring: mashed potatoes, non-alcoholic punch, green bean casserole, rolls with butter, pumpkin pie, or introduce us to your favorite dish!

The Brooklyn Ark will provide turkey, gravy, and stuffing.

Please RSVP on here on MeetUp & on our Facebook Event.
results.name: From Out of Town?  Celebrate THANKSGIVING With Us

results.description:
I know that some of you do not have family around here (or maybe you just don't like them all that much) LOL But whatever the reason if you do not have plans for Thanksgiving you are more than welcome to come here. I figure we can start with appetizers at 2pm, dinner around 4pm and dessert around 6pm. So when you RSVP consider the time you plan to arrive and choose an item or two from that list to bring, plan on spending around $10. If you come empty handed the cost is $15 but I do hope that most of you prepare something or at least bring something nice. This is a holiday after all. I will make a turkey and if the headcount gets big I may ask for someone to also bring turkey.

So please post what you are bringing and if you change your mind about coming let me know so I can be sure that someone else brings it. Again this is a holiday and we want it to be nice and stores won't be open for me to run out to get what someone failed to bring.

I look forward to breaking bread and giving thanks with YOU

With Love, Cassie

Items Needed: cheese and crackers,  anti pasta platter, sweet potato casserole wine, beer,  ice (2 bags), or something that is a tradition for you please list it

Bringing: Sonia/mashed potatoes and corn , Danielle/pecan and pumpkin pie, stuffing and rolls, Ira/fruit salad, Henry/shrimp and cocktail sauce, Takuya/gravy, green beans and salad, Nancy/rolls,cranberry sauce, wine


*If you can not come no need to post why, we understand and will catch you another time*
results.how_to_find_us: white house, black trim (GPS may say you are here 2 blocks too soon)

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

results.description:
I know many of you are out-of-towners, thus, are lacking great Thanksgiving Day plans. But fear not, your vegan friends are here for you. Let's spend the holiday together!


Fyi, the downtown Peacefood location recently got a new menu, and let me say, it is so bomb. I can only hope their Thanksgiving dinner is half as good. They've created a special menu for this festive day.


And while yes, I do have family in NY and can have dinner with them, I'm not sure I can take another holiday of my extended family ridiculing me for my "odd turkey substitutes". So I'm going to spend the day with you lovely ladies instead. All are welcome!

If anyone has any other ideas for the rest of the day, let a girl know! Volunteering perhaps? Just throwin' it out there

results.description:
These folks are not invited.

Why because we don't need or want to have anyone's body (or several of their bodies) headless, without feathers and roasted in an oven as a centerpiece on a holiday table. Corpse cuisine is just so last century. Don't you agree?

So who are the uninvited?  Have a look at the link below to understand what the majority of people are putting on their tables for ingestion Thursday, November 26. Prepare to have your heart broken.

http://www.farmsanctuary.org/learn/factory-farming/turkeys-used-for-meat/


Who would they be if we didn't interfere? They would be who you see in the photo above. Free living, social non-human animals.

Turkey story #1: The boyfriend and I were driving through the Adirondack Park in early October and all of a sudden we had to hit the brakes. About a dozen turkeys were making their way across the road. We were all cognizant of one another for those few minutes, making eye contact and constantly checking in until they were in the clear and we were able to drive on. Two worlds met in a heartbeat - the world of free living animals with their own society and the world of humans that have paved through their realm without thought.

Turkey story #2: A few years ago VegOut went to the Catskill Animal Sanctuary for a Volunteer Farm Chore Day. I happened upon the great sheep Rambo who presided over the main barn with care for those he saw in his dominion. In the stillness of the moment, the greatness of his presence calmed me. He folded his legs beneath his body so that his torso was on the barn floor. Three turkeys walked up to him, knelt and lay their necks over his back. Rambo and the turkeys shut their eyes. I wish I knew their names. Kathy Stevens, the Director of CAS, writes in Animal Camp about the Audacity of Love. This blissful image of love informs me daily.

Learn more about Rambo, the teacher and flock caregiver, here:

https://casanctuary.org/2012/05/rambo-moves-on/


So what can we do on Thanksgiving? We can be thankful for knowing about these magnificent birds. We can hold them close in our hearts. In all likelihood, we all share a bird eating past. Some of us share a bird eating present. I encourage everyone to make the acquaintance of a turkey. Get to know an individual. Cooked muscle has been a part of our lives at one point or another. Let's get to know these birds. Guilt sucks so let's not pointlessly indulge. The point is, we know better and can celebrate abundance in the here and now. As a human animal, what is abundance? Well, relative to our peers around the globe we can sleep indoors and have potable water with little thought. We can think about what to bring! what to bring! to a potluck knowing that some of us will wow with culinary sophistication and others will elevate a humble ingredient simply and elegantly. Cedar planked leek/shiitake stuffed seitan served with cranberry/shiraz reduction or a humble potato coaxed to perfection with a little salt, some fresh ground pepper and a splash of olive oil? Decisions decisions. Both are magnificent.


What am I thankful for? I am thankful for ever evolving consciousness. I am thankful for the many friendships that I've made and that you have all made through VegOut. Most of all I'm thankful for turkeys and grateful for how they enrich our world. Their absence during this holiday season is my wish for them and you.

The Details:

Please bring a vegan dish (no meat, fish, eggs, dairy, or honey) or drink to share.


Please take your rsvp seriously. This is Thanksgiving. We can accommodate 15 people. You will be reminded a few days ahead to update your rsvp if you can't make it so that someone else can. This is a private residence so let's respect Abdullah's neighbors by being mindful of unnecessary noise. If you're tempted to wear a lampshade, come to New Year's Eve. :-)

Getting there:

F train. Ditmas Avenue stop. Exact address will be messaged to attendees 24 hour before.

Consult tripplanner on www.mta.info.

Accessibility:

The F train stop before Ditmas, Church Avenue, has an elevator. Abdullah's apartment is lobby level. There are no stairs to enter the building or apartment.

**********

SAVE THE DATE: Saturday, December 12 Holiday Potluck in Central Harlem.

Have nothing planned for Thanksgiving afternoon?  Don't stay home.  Come out & join me at my favorite diner!  There's lots to be thankful for & I'm thankful we have this opportunity for a friendly & enjoyable meal.  (Thanks Ken!)

Wayne Hills Diner & Restaurant is one of the most underrated diner in New Jersey; food and service are excellent & they have a full service bar   One of the specials on Thanksgiving will be a turkey dinner besides their regular menu. They do all of their own baking.


Fourteen of us did this 2 years ago & we had some very lively & enjoyable conversations. Just like then, they'll give us separate checks.

 I'll be inviting members of another group.

Please don't respond if you're not attending.  If you RSVP yes & your plans change, please update so we have an accurate count & Wayne Hills can set up the tables before we get there.

To look at the menu, click below:
http://www.waynehillsdiner.com

results.description:
Hi. Thanks giving day is rough for vegans. if we are lucky enough to have family or are invited to be with people, we often get henpecked by those same people and family as to why we are not eating the same food they are. very stressful. makes us wish we were sitting in ejector seats so we could rocket out of there and land in the collective laps of our vegan pacifist friends. also, some members have no family, and nowhere to go. so, we are doing a TG sanctuary at veggie heaven, which is open TG day. they have thanksgiving options and also offer their regular menu. no upfront feeeees, this is not a fundraiser. (thank you to all those who attended oakland, Jan Fredericks was very happy to see all of you)   so;


our-


'Protect our Normally Happy Vegans' -'TG Hereditary Familial Insanity'

                     'Prevention Intervention Sanctuary Gathering'

will start as 4pm for those that have no one to be with. i won't be there till 5pm-ish. we will be there till they close at 10pm, or later, if Gary and staff is doing their usual after hour boogie. if any one has nothing to do alll day and wants to come earlier than 4pm and wait for the others to come over as the plan, or after suffering their families so they can have bubble teas, eat tofu cheese cake and belch in relative peace without being noggined with their mammie's rolling pin, let me know. i will arrange that a table be reserved at a sooner time. when you rsvp, you may want to add the time you intend to come, in the comments section in case others want to try to match up and plan accordingly. if you decide at the last minute to come and haven't rsvp'd, that's ok, too.  so you there, you turkeys!!
results.name: Thnks gving day thr26 veggie heaven gathering

results.description:
Hello Loyal Cowboy Fans,

I feel confident in saying there are at least two things ALL Cowboy Fans are thankful for: the return of Romo and a W on the board!

Although, this Thursday will not be an "official" meet-up, we wanted you to know that Stone Creek will be open for anyone who wants to watch Dallas take on Carolina at our usual spot. There is even a Thanksgiving Day menu to keep you in the spirit of the holiday.

Wherever you go, or whatever you do, make sure you are still rooting for Dem Boys and see you all next week!

GO COWBOYS!!!!!

Tave - CFFL (Cowboy Fan For Life)

results.description: This is our annual Thanksgiving party, and you don't want to miss it! I cook turkey, you bring something tasty from your own country or ethnic background, and we go Karaoke in Flushing afterwards. If you come please know that Karaoke will be around $30, and you must come to both the dinner and Karaoke, because we will split the cost of the Karaoke room. The Karaoke room includes free food and drink. I will give you my address after to confirm your invitation. Please only sign up if you're sure you will come. Let me know if you have any questions. Hope to see you!
results.name: Thanksgiving Potluck & Karaoke

results.description:
ADDRESS IS 143 EAST 49th

San Martin- Thanksgiving
143 East 49th Street (Lexington and 3rd)
Thursday, November 26th
5pm drinks, 5:30 dinner.
$76 Turkey dinner, unlimited wine, tax and tip. To join this event you must RSVP here and prepay on our website at http://thesinglegourmet.net/event/san-martin/ RSVP must be prepaid in order to guarantee a seat. All of our tables are preset before events based on demographics and restaurants require a guarantee headcount before an event. We will have 20-30 at this event.
Thanksgiving is a day of tradition, so why should dinners with the Single Gourmet be any different? Art has been taking the group here for many years and I continued the tradition last year and the meal was fantastic. With multiple helpings of turkey, unlimited wine and lots of sides, enjoy the day of thanks with our group and new and old friends. There is no guest surcharge tonight so bring your family members. The menu includes crepes stuffed with spinach and ricotta cheese, topped with sun dried tomato, salmon cakes with jalapeno pepper sauce, corn and red pepper chowder, roast turkey with stuffing, yams puree with maple syrup and vegies, cranberry sauce and gravy, pumpkin pie, chocolate fudge cake, apple tart and NY cheese cake

Hi Everyone!

I will not be going home for Thanksgiving this year and I wondered who else from this amazing group was going to be in town and had no place to go. I thought it would be nice to host a dinner at my place.   

I will be make the Turkey, Whipped sweet potatoes and collared greens.   If you are coming it will be Potluck style.  Bring a dish that is a family tradition for the holiday or none traditional.

If you want to drink please bring a bottle of wine. Or the cocktail of your choice.  I will be making a Mulled Spike Apple Cider. 

Please RSVP and let us know what dish you will be bringing along.  The same rules apply to Michelle's RSVPs. 

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on the night of November 23th  Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole.

I have a lhasa apso so you should be pet friendly.  Please feel free to ask any questions.  Here are  few links with recipe ideas.


http://bit.ly/1uL3wtF     Ideas from Food Network 

http://bit.ly/1W2GxZQ   Ideas from Southern Cooking

results.description:
No family in the city? Don't feel like travelling this year? Or just sick of your obnoxious Uncle Herman and his disgusting cigars?

Well then, come enjoy the holiday with meetup friends, old and new!


IMPORTANT: 

A) Everyone pays in full for what they order, plus tax and tip.

B) There is a $5 event fee to attend, which must be paid in advance and is in addition to the cost of your meal. This prevents excessive no-shows, which would make an accurate restaurant reservation impossible, as well as disappointing the people who actually do come. The funds will be used to help cover the organizer dues that I must pay to Meetup to keep the groups going.

C) You will automatically be transferred to Paypal when you RSVP Yes.

D) Confidential RSVP option - if you don't want your name or picture to appear on this page, then use this link to pay the event fee and do NOT RSVP on this page: 

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=Y8EU2VRP6QL38

Note: Please use one method or the other, not both.

========================================

The restaurant's full regular menu will be available: 

http://www.theraillinediner.com/menu.html


Prix Fixe: $30.95 

This has to be one of the best Thanksgiving deals in New York! 

Included: choice of entree (see list), cup of soup (see list), Greek salad or tossed salad, choice of potato (see list) and vegetable (see list), choice of dessert, coffee or tea... plus a glass of wine!


Entree: 

• roast turkey with chestnut stuffing

• roast prime rib

• broiled baby lamb chops

• broiled filet of lemon sole

• broiled filet of salmon


Soup: cream of turkey, split pea, chicken noodle

Potato: sweet potato, baked, mashed, french fries

Vegetable: corn, string beans, broccoli, spinach, peas, carrots

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's

newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

You must go to their website to register www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

Each year The New York Social Network puts together a special Thanksgiving Dinner for our members and friends who can not be with their families ( or do not want to be with their families!! ;) ).  It is a fun way to enjoy the holiday and get your fix of  Turkey (and other tasty dishes)!  We expect 16 members to join us this year for our 4th year back at Merchants River House overlooking the Hudson River and NY Harbor.  If there are more we will make room!  Following the dinner you are welcome to stay for cocktails at the bar.  We will use our famous rotating seat format where you will switch seats several times during the meal to sit with all new people.

You will have a choice of a traditional Turkey Dinner or several ala carte menu items including pasta, vegetarian options and fish. Menu posted shortly.

$70 includes: choice of appetizer, entree, sides, dessert, coffee tea, 1 glass of wine or beer, tax and tip. Organizers meal

Can I come alone? Yes 100% of those attending will likely be coming on their own.

Dress code: keep it neat. (no jackets or dresses required)

Prepayment only, NO refunds after November 23rd
results.name: Rotating Thanksgiving Dinner For Those Who Can't Get Home To Family

results.description:
You spoke, we listened, we put it to work.

Every Thursday the Men Of Salsa in association with Eddie Batiz and Ric Quinones, will bring Latin Thursdays at Bar 13 to an ever expanding universe of discerning Latin music fans. Let’s re-write what an after work party in NYC is all about. Every Thursday you can expect:
• A beautiful room with a premium sound system and ample seating.
• 2 for 1 drink specials from 6pm to 8pm, ALL types, all brands, top to bottom. You ask for it, you get 2 for it. Anything!
Hourly All Night drink specials, to be announced throughout the evening, with a variety of offerings, from shots to mixed cocktails.
• Arguably one of THE best after work appetizer menus in NYC, with over 25 delicious food items at just $7 each!
• A rotation of the highly acclaimed DJ’s of Men Of Salsa. It’s not hype. It’s a fact.
• Save the best for last: No Cover. Like ever AND over 5 large Hi-Def TV's for all sporting events, including the World Series!

AFTERWORK THURSDAYS AT BAR 13, NYC
"Where the working class meets the drinking glass"
results.name: Latin Afterwork Thursdays | Bar 13 | All New

results.description:
As seen in the CNBC Documentary The Bitcoin Uprising.

Starting at 6:00 p.m. Bitcoin Center NYC welcomes Satoshi Square for a night of spontaneous Bitcoin trading in a LIVE open outcry trading pit. Buy or sell Bitcoins with Satoshi Square and others, or just observe and enjoy a party among fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts. Open bar!

This event is perfect for expert and novice traders as well as exhibitors, vendors, hardware and software developers, educators, students, media, and anyone wanting to be acquainted with the technology. Talk to our experts and get feedback concerning Bitcoin-related startups.

No matter the focus of your Bitcoin interest or your expertise level, you are welcome. Bring a friend who might have read or heard something about Bitcoin. With our assistance he or she will leave with a better understanding and their first electronic or paper wallet. 

All trading is organic, spontaneous, and occurs directly between sellers and buyers. There are no intermediaries, and no fees as we are neither a trading floor nor a brokerage. Drinks and hospitality are courtesy of Bitcoin Center NYC. 

Details follow. See you there!

Every Thursday Night

6:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m.

Bitcoin Center NYC

25 Cleveland Place

New York, NY 10012

Find Bitcoin Center NYC on Facebook, LinkedIn, Meetup, and Twitter.

All guests of Bitcoin Center NYC are required to sign in.  Media must RSVP using [masked].
results.name: Satoshi Thursday! Bitcoin Meetup - P2P Bitcoin Trading

group.name: Bitcoin Center NYC (located 25 Cleveland Place, SoHo NYC)

The group completes a 3-mile loop. Upon returning to the store, people have the option to head out for an additional 3 miles on a slightly different route or stay. We help match you to others of a similar pace. All paces and smiley faces welcome.

results.description:
This will be a free Zurich event - thanks to Prof. Dr. Markus Leippold, Direktor Master of Advanced Studies UZH in Finance for kindly hosting this event and for Swati Mital for organising. The talk will be at 6.15pm Zurich time. There will also be post-events drinks (location tba).

Full title: Portfolio Optimization, Regression and Conic Programming

Abstract: Using examples from portfolio management and quantitative trading we illustrate the power and flexibility of conic programming. We point to various common mistakes in setting up portfolio models and in solving them algorithmically. Several Python code fragments are given.

Bio

Dr. Thomas Schmelzer is Head of Quantitative Research at a Geneva based wealth manager. He has a PhD. in Mathematics from University of Oxford where he was a Rhodes Scholar at Balliol College. In his previous roles he has held key positions in the UK, Liechtenstein and Switzerland including Senior Researcher at Winton Capital Management and a Quantitative Portfolio Manager at Oxford Asset Management.
results.name: Seminar (Zurich) - Thomas Schmelzer - Portfolio Opt, Regression & Conic Prog

results.description:
I can't believe it is Thanksgiving again already! My family no longer gets together for this holiday so I have been sharing Thanksgiving with you guys for the last few years and it has been great!

As always I will contribute my annual maple bacon turkey with corn bread stuffing, some fall cocktail, one side, and a dessert. 

To participate please bring at least one popular thanksgiving side, or dessert. We don't need anymore turkey :-) 

I always enjoyed martha stewart thanksgiving sides so here is a link to give you some ideas. Feel free to use any or come up with your own recipes. 

http://www.marthastewart.com/274421/thanksgiving-side-dish-recipes/@center/1009076/thanksgiving-side-dishes-appetizers


http://www.marthastewart.com/275598/thanksgiving-desserts

If you wish to drink with us please contribute a bottle of wine or a cocktail. 

This is a potluck party, but you may do finishing touches in the apartment. 

I have a small 7lb hypo allergenic Yorkie Poo named Pepper, he is really sweet and loves people, but if you have an issue with dogs please refrain from RSVPing to this event.

I do post this dinner on another site as well so I am starting with only five spaces, but depending on attendance form the other site this may increase so please don't fear joining the waiting list on this one. 

The fine print:

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on the night of November 26th  Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.

Join us for a discussion based on the book In Search of Reality by Cecil A. Poole.

This week we will be discussing the topics from the Chapter 5: Metaphysics and Religion.

You can download the free e-book here!

In reading this book, anyone interested in mysticism and spirituality will have a better idea of Rosicrucian philosophy.

Some of the topics to be covered include:

The Language of Metaphysics, The Meaning of Metaphysics, Metaphysics and Personal Evolvement, Some Applications of Metaphysics, Metaphysics and Religion, Metaphysics and the Psychic, Metaphysics and Practical Living, and Realization of Reality

All are Welcome!

results.description:
Since our regular meetup falls on Thanksgiving, we will cancel it for November, and since it falls on Christmas eve next month, that one will be cancelled as well.

The restaurant where we have been meeting for over 20 years has announced that it is closing, we are now looking for a new venue somewhere in Manhattn. Suggestions are welcome. We need a place that will give us separate checks, and which is flexible about the size of the group since there is no way for us to know how many people are actually coming any given month. It should be fairly near public transit, and have available street parking.

Poly munch, where we gather to "munch" on food, and chat. This is a family friendly social event for poly, poly friendly, and poly curious folks. There is no charge for this meetup beyond what you order from the menu.

We are having a little potluck on the night of Thanksgiving for anyone not going home to family! 

Come and plug in, talk about Orgasmic Meditation, the core practice we teach here at OneTaste, and meet some awesome people

Doors open @ 7:45pm and the event goes 'til 9:30.

results.description:
If you don’t have family here in New York or simply don’t celebrate Thanksgiving, we would like you to join us for concert of house band of café Wha?  This is iconic venue located on McDougal Street in the heart of the bohemia since 1969s. Artists, poets, writers, singers and musicians what inspired new movement in culture and spread it all over the world. 

Jazz, blues, Motown, Reggae, R&B, and Classic/ Alternative/ Modern rock, punk, rock`n`roll – this street have seen it all. Café Wha? was founded in 1969 and since then known for its performers: Jimi Hendrix, Bruce Springsteen, Woody Allen, Lenny Bruce, Bill Cosby and Richard Pryor got early chances to hone their talents. Mary Travers, before she was the Mary of Peter, Paul and Mary, was a waitress there. Motown, Reggae, R&B, and Classic/ Alternative/ Modern rock

Door Time: 8:30 PM

The World Famous Cafe Wha? House Band is truly a powerhouse of talent. Featuring a full 9-piece band, this world renowned house band has been in existence in some form or another since 1988.

The Cafe Wha? House Band performs the biggest musical hits of the last 50 years every Wednesday through Sunday right here at Cafe Wha? You never know which famous musician might be sitting in with the Cafe Wha? Band any night, and you could be privy to a once-in-a-lifetime, up close and personal performance!

Young or old, the Cafe Wha? House Band will surely entertain any music fan all night long. Come on down and hear “The Best Damn Band in New York City!”
 

Show Times and Cover Charges:

Doors open and seating starts every night at 8:00pm. For 9:00 pm shows, ALL members of your party must arrive by 8:45 to be guaranteed seating. Your reservation is not guaranteed if you show up after 8:45 pm (even if you come with your entire group). 

Guests from the 9:00 pm show on Friday and Saturday night who wish to stay for the second show at 11:15 pm may be subject to a $6 "stay cover" charge. Guests will be alerted prior to the second showing if this stay cover is in effect.

Weekdays: Cafe Wha? permits guests under 21 to attend our shows if accompanied by an adult. There is a $20 minimum for guests under 21 on weekdays, in addition to the evenings cover charge.

There is a video of this café Wha? and the house band: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vpn8YbVCTYQ
results.name: Thanksgiving celebration in Cafe Wha? concert. Everyone is invited.

results.description:
Let's break bad spending habits by joining forces with like minded people worldwide and buying nothing on "Black Friday"!

https://www.adbusters.org/campaigns/bnd

Note: We're against wasting resources by way of consumerism, not against participating in the economy.

How can we show appreciation to family and friends without falling into the depths of consumerism?

*A gift of our time*

*A gift of something we made*

*A gift of something "vintage" meaningful to the recipient*

*A gift of something that rewards the value of labor while minimizing fossil fuel costs such as a CSA share, a locally produced product, or a membership at a local Botanical Garden (best purchased on a day other than "Buy Nothing Day" of course)*

What are your ideas?
results.name: Let's observe International Buy Nothing Day!

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Challenge with The Rise

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

results.description:
LEADER: Daphne Downes ([masked] or[masked])

RATING:  B 4 C+

A leisurely 4-mile hike around picturesque Sterling Lake. Plan on stopping at the "beach" for a short break, so be sure to bring a snack and water. Park car in Visitor Parking lot and meet at Visitor’s Center (across the road) at 10:00 AM. TC Sterling Forest map 100.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B-7-A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.

venue.name: American Indian Museum / Old US Custom House

results.description:
November is American Indian Heritage month, so let's celebrate the Day after Thanksgiving by visiting on of NYC's most beautiful buildings - the Smithsonian Museum of the American Indian also known as the Alexander Hamilton Custom's House.  A perfect antidote to Black Friday!

If you are already familiar with the museum kindly give others a chance to sign up first!  RSVP'S BEGIN  TUESDAY NIGHT AT 10:00PM!

PLAN TO ARRIVE BY 10:45AM. NOTE THAT THIS IS A FEDERAL SITE SO WE ALL HAVE TO PASS THROUGH AIRPORT-STYLE METAL DETECTORS. WE WILL MEET IN THE LOBBY NEAR THE MAIN ENTRANCE after you pass security - THERE ARE BENCHES FOR SITTING ON ONE END AND RESTROOMS ARE AVAILABLE.  

This experience will feature a guided tour of the exhibition:  Glittering World: Navajo Jewelry of the Yazzie Family.   I will also provide an overview of the building's history and architecture which is a hallmark of the Beaux Arts Classical period which lasted from the 1890's until World War I. 

The exhibit features almost 300 examples of contemporary jewelry made by several members of the Yazzie family—shows how the family’s art flows from their Southwest environs and strong connection to their Navajo culture. With historic pieces from the museum’s collections, the exhibition places Navajo jewelry making within its historical context of art and commerce, illustrates its development as a form of cultural expression, and explores the meanings behind its symbolism. 

Aftrerwards there will be time to explore the other museum exhibits and  I will then lead an approximateone-hour historic walk through part of Lower Manhattan!   This walk will focus on American Indian history in New York City going back to the pre-European settlements and the period of Dutch colonial rule in the 17th century.  We will also take in Battery Park and the first immigration station at Castle Clinton and along with several other historic sites in Lower Manhattan - weather and time permitted.

For those interested after the walk we can have lunch at a local eatery starting around 2:00pm.


Note this experience will cost $5.00 (suggested donation) - 100% of which will go the museum in support of their educational programs.

Thank you for your cooperation!

Hank

[masked]

results.name: Honoring Our First Americans with a Museum Visit and Historic Walking Tour

results.description:
The FOREST PLAY SCHOOL MIXED AGE GROUP meets on Mondays at 12:30pm, Wednesdays at 9:30am and Fridays at 12:30pm.  You can join for just one day, two days or all three - whatever your preference.  The location is a set forest location in Mamaroneck area.  Please email me - [masked] if you'd like to join or learn more details.

The Southern Westchester Attachment Parenting (SWAP) group has openings in our Forest Play School group for children ages 2-6 (siblings are welcome). We are currently meeting on Mondays and Friday approximately noon until 4:30 at a Mamaroneck forest location and Wednesdays at 9:30.  You can join for one or more of these days - whatever works best for you.

Forest play school is a nature-based option that is held exclusively outdoors. Whatever the weather (rain, snow, cold), children are encouraged to play, explore and learn in a designated outdoor forest environment where the children and parents meet each week all year. This play school is play-based and parent supervision is meant to assist rather than lead. The structure of the group is inspired by the Forest Kindergarten program, which is very popular in other parts of the world and is gradually spreading throughout the US. Cutting-edge research is showing that direct exposure to nature is essential for healthy childhood development - physical, emotional, and spiritual.  The children are engaging in very important "work" through playing and navigating relationships in play school.

Each parent practices gentle guidance, patience and positive role modeling for all of the children while helping them navigate sometimes complex social situations.  Our goal is for each child to feel safe and respected by the mothers and their peers while at play school.  Each week the parents read a parenting article on positive/gentle parenting in order to discuss together.

The children feel at home in our forest location.  We prepare ourselves appropriately for the day's weather, practically this means layers, extra clothes, and sun/wind/rain/snow protection. The children find joy and amusement from the sticks, stones, bugs and plants around them, therefore they don't need to bring toys to play school. A spirit of open exploration and creativity permeates the group.  Each parent brings their own healthy food for their children (either lunch or snacks, depending on the family’s needs).  Most days include some songs and read-alouds.


Here is what some of the parents are saying:


“We love our time in the forest.  Being in the forest feels therapeutic for me and the kids.  The forest is our little sanctuary where time stands still.  The children feel deeply connected to the forest - they uncover the details of their forest home more and more each week and watch the seasons unfold right before their eyes.  There is something so magical about having no toys and watching them play so creatively.  This type of play is so ideal for problem solving, critical thinking and decision making. And the physical environment is so wonderful for gross and fine motor skill development- it provides so much more than a playground ever could!”
results.name: Rock Climbers - Forest Play School

results.description:
The Santa hats are back! We are asking activists to wear the Santa hats we purchased & many will hold “Santa Says Don’t Buy Fur” posters. (We’ll take the hats back at the end to clean them and reuse them through the rest of December’s demos.)
Time: 1:00 – 3:00pm (don’t miss the march around Macy’s Herald Square @ 2pm) - with March around Herald Square at 2:00pm
PLACE: Macy’s 151 W. 34th St., NY, NY (34 St. entrance)
See you Friday! *If you have any friends in the media, please let them know about the animals’ big day!

******* FUR FREE FRIDAY demo @ Macy's on West 34th Street, NYC*******

This is it folks, the busiest shopping day of the year, as well as the central and most symbolic annual demonstration of the animal rights community's immutable ou...trage over the ceaseless trapping, confinement, torture and murder of 'furbearing' mammals, and the subsequent commercial sale/use of their skin/fur as whimsical "fashion" / luxury apparel, etc.

On the cusp of the annual shopping frenzy that sweeps our consumerist society like a hysterical, blinding wave, it is critical that we ACTivists do ACT, manifestly demonstrating our love and compassion for our furry mammalian cousins, sentient beings similar to us in so many ways, yet whom most of our society considers little more than live material, whose unique purpose on the earth is to be used/utilized in whatever manner humans see fit.

We who understand that animals live for their own purposes, that humans should be protecting them (vs. killing and using them), must take it upon ourselves to stand up for the innumerable thousands whose terrified screams go unheard, whose pathetic pleas for mercy are responded to with blows, with lethal poison gas, with instruments of maiming and torture.

On Fur Free Friday we must make a strong, declarative, vociferous show of solidarity, to let the heartless exploiters and the complicit consumers alike know that we animal lovers and liberationists are not going away; that we are united, strong and resolutely determined in our mission of exposing the industry lies/whitewash, working toward a day when the fur industry collapses indefinitely into abolition, and seeing our land-dwelling mammal friends free to live unhindered by humans, as much as is possible in habitats increasingly encroached upon by a continuously expanding human population. PLEASE come out and help us get the word out that compassion is the fashion, and fur is DEAD!

****FUR FREE FRIDAY NYC, 2015 ****

WHERE: Macy's Department Store, 151 West 34th Street
New York, NY 10001.
WHEN: Friday, November 27th, 2015 { Fur Free Friday}.
TIME: From 1:00pm -3:00pm.

This year, as we did last year, we will be employing HUGE VIDEO SCREENS and amplified sound depicting the horror of fur. Nothing reaches people like those images, be a part of the education! We'll be marching around the entire store. Please come!

Activists are invited to gather from 1:00pm forward in front of Macy's Department Store at 151 West 34th Street. If there are any questions about directions to and from this location in Manhattan, please send an e-mail to CAAF at [masked]

We and other groups participating in Fur Free Friday will have plenty of signs, literature and relevant props to share with interested members of the general public. All YOU need to bring is yourself and your voice to speak up for the voiceless, who cannot articulate their own wish to freely live out their lives under the sun, to frolic and to bear young, to behave in accordance with their own natures with no interference from our species.
results.name: Fur Free Friday demonstration@ Macy's on West 34th Street, NYC

results.description:
RSVP'S CLOSED.

PLEASE READ THIS CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU RSVP. I TAKE THE RSVP PROCESS SERIOUSLY AND EXPECT THAT YOU SHOULD TOO.


Join me and AMC Club members who do not have to RSVP ( unless you don't get last minute e-mails from the Club) on this fun event that I have been doing the day after Thanksgiving for many years now with AMC.

Unlock the secrets of the unique spaces and memorials of Lower Manhattan.  (This is an expanded version of a tour I once led for Open House New York for some five years) Join me for a fast paced but fun expedition mostly along the lower Manhattan waterfront where we will see some remnants of old New York, many unique and haunting memorials and some beautiful parks. We'll end up at the Fulton Transit Center. When we move, we will go at a fast pace but I will stop very briefly a number of times to talk about what we see. Even if you have done this with me in the past, there will always be surprises along the way. You will see things you never saw before. This hiking tour will be about  4 miles. WE WILL FINISH AROUND 5 P.M.   NO FOOD STOPS.

We leave ON TIME. BE READY TO GO.

 I WILL SEND AN E-MAIL TO THOSE WHO RSVP'D WITH MEETING DETAILS WEDNESDAY EVENING.

Please consider joining the Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC) ) http://www.amc-ny.org/ The Club offers many hikes, walks and events and is also active in conservation efforts and trail maintenance. Only a few of the many hikes and walks that are offered by AMC leaders are posted on Meetup. Since this event will be posted as a last minute hike to AMC Club members there is NO need for AMC Club members to RSVP for this-UNLESS you do not get last minute e-mails about Club events-and you should in order to fully take advantage of your membership. IF YOU ARE A DUES PAYING AMC MEMBER AND DON’T GET THESE E-MAILS, LET ME KNOW A FEW DAYS BEFORE THE EVENT AND I’LL TELL YOU HOW. Let’s leave 10 spaces for AMC Meetup members. Priority will be given to those who have previously attended other AMC Meetup events-it does not have to be mine-and have some attachment to the Club.

Needless to say, please take the RSVP process seriously and be considerate to me and your fellow Meetup members. If you’ve been a NO SHOW on any hike that I have led (check your attendance history)  or you are a chronic abuser of the RSVP process, please do not RSVP. Unfortunately, you will not be able to attend.

I am going to ask that people not post any comments or questions prior to the event. You will have all the information you need to do this once you get the meeting place details. No offense, but I don’t need to know what you are doing that day (and probably neither does anyone else) if you can’t make it or what you think the weather will be. AFTER the event, post as many comments and photos as you like.

If the weather is really bad or there is a really bad forecast, Check Accuweather like I do, I will post a notice by very early on the day of the event canceling. If there is no notice, we go.
results.name: On the Waterfront- and Much More! Day After Thanksgiving

group.name: Appalachian Mountain Club New York-North Jersey

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Event Type: Museum

Admission Price: FREE admission: 4:00 p.m.–8:00 p.m.

Description:

Museum of the Moving Image advances the understanding, enjoyment, and appreciation of the art, history, technique, and technology of film, television, and digital media by presenting exhibitions, education programs, significant moving-image works, and interpretive programs, and collecting and preserving moving-image related artifacts.

Attractions:

• Film Screenings


• Core Exhibition: 

The exhibition incorporates approximately 1,400 artifacts from the Museum’s collection of the material culture of the moving image. These include historic film and television cameras, projectors, television sets, sound recording equipment, costumes, set design sketches and models, make-up, fan magazines, posters, and an outstanding collection of licensed merchandise—dolls, toys, board games, lunch boxes, and more. The Museum has also been a pioneer in collecting video arcade and console games, which are on exhibit and available for play by visitors. Recently acquired objects on view include makeup used on the stars of Sex in the City, a mechanical prop designed by Mike Marino for a climactic scene in Black Swan, and molds and prototypes produced during the creation of a King Kong action figure. 

• Café

• Classic Video Arcade

• Stylish Theater(s)

• Futuristic Interior Design

• More Futuristic Interior Design

Reference Links:

http://www.movingimage.us/

http://www.yelp.com/biz/museum-of-the-moving-image-Astoria

Disclaimer:

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/pages/Disclaimer/

END
results.name: Explore Museum of the Moving Image (Free Admission)

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
It's Meetup Time Again!

This time, I thought I'd give a "theme" to our gathering. As Iceland Airwaves has recently concluded, I got to catch up with some folks who've just returned and were sharing their excitement about their recent trip. It got me thinking that it might be nice to get together and share our own stories, photos, travel tips, etc., of previous trips to Iceland with anyone either thinking of making their maiden voyage or returning yet again!

Let's get together and be ready to show our photo galleries, share tips and tell stories of our Icelandic adventures. Any hidden gems that you've discovered along the way? How do you make the most of your time there? What's not to miss? Restaurants, night life, cultural activities? Make a list and bring it! 

I will have some cool articles and resources that will be useful to both the new and seasoned traveler. And of course, feel free to have a go at using whatever Icelandic you may have picked up on your journey...try out what you've learned!

Shake off your post-Thanksgiving blues and come on out! And for the newcomers, you'll be able to spot me wearing one of my Icelandic t-shirts.
results.name: So You've Always Wanted to Go to Iceland?

results.description:
A FREE and mostly vegan community meal we make together with love, mostly using food we rescued from the trash. We’ll gather in celebration of Buy Nothing Day – a holiday designed to get people thinking about how workers, the environment, and animals are harmed in making the products we buy, and about all the good things we can do with our time instead of shopping. We’ll share meal planning, cooking, and other food prep skills, tell stories and jokes, meet new people and reconnect with old friends, and generally unplug from the current world order as we build community. If you are not a skilled cook, it is OK! If you are, that’s great! You can plan a dish or two from the ingredients we have on hand, and get help if you want it. All participants should plan to help in some way, even if other commitments prevent you arriving on time. Media WILL be welcome with appointment, but journalists will be required to respect the wishes of those who do not want to be photographed.

It will be held at a volunteer’s home accessible by NYC Transit. RSVP (at least a day ahead) to Janet at (347)[masked] for the location. We’ll meet at 5:30pm to begin cooking and preparation.
results.name: Buy Nothing Day Freegan Feast!

Mary Owen, daughter of Donna Reed.


http://www.nyhistory.org/sites/default/files/styles/gallery_item_thumb/public/Widmer--formatted_0.jpg?itok=YsEo-qee


Ted Widmer

EVENT DETAILS

"Justice in Film
Join us for the New-York Historical Society’s film series, featuring opening remarks by notable directors, writers, actors, and historians. This series explores how film has tackled social conflict, morality, and the perennial struggles between right and wrong that are waged from the highest levels of government to the smallest local communities.

It’s a Wonderful Life (1946)
Celebrate the holiday season with one of the most enduring films of all time. Jimmy Stewart stars as George Bailey, a man who finds meaning in his life on Christmas Eve. Directed by Frank Capra. Starring James Stewart, Donna Reed, Lionel Barrymore. 130 min.

REMARKS

Mary Owen is the daughter of actress Donna Reed and serves on the board of directors for the Donna Reed Foundation for the Performing Arts. Ted Widmer, a historian and author, is former director and librarian of the John Carter Brown Library as well as a former speechwriter for the Clinton White House.

LOCATION

The Robert H. Smith Auditorium at the New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024 "
results.name: "It's a Wonderful Life" - Movie Introduction by Donna Reed's daughter, Mary Owen

At the N-Y Historical Society (77th & Central Park West), we are meeting on Friday, November 27 at 6 pm, which is when the first come-first serve free movie tickets are distributed.

Admission is "pay what you wish" to gain entrance, and a group of us will be sitting as we explore film topics. 

The movie, It's a Wonderful Life, begins at 7 but in case tickets are in short supply, we're arriving early :-) Donna Reed's daughter will co-host.

See you there!

results.description:
Please join the Unitarian Universalist Congregation of the Palisades (UUCP) for “A Dickens of a Holiday Party!”

Here's a great alternative to Black Friday - we're having a pot luck dinner with friends to kick off the holiday season on Friday, November 27 at 6:00 PM. Bring some of your Thanksgiving leftover main course, side dishes, and desert goodies to share. We'll provide hot cider, coffee, tea, and maybe a wassail bowl or two. Feel free to bring your own wine.

We will be having a viewing of the 1951 version of "A Christmas Carol" with Alastair Sim. Before the film, Reverend Paul Dodenhoff will be sharing some comments on Charles Dickens and his connection to Unitarianism, some thoughts on the text of "A Christmas Carol", and social justice work in Victorian England. After the film, we'll have time for dessert and some questions and discussions.

Also, please bring canned and/or non-perishable items for donation to the CFA.

We look forward to seeing you!
results.name: A Dickens of a Holiday Party!

group.name: Unitarian Universalist Congregation of the Palisades

results.description:
As you get caught celebrating Thanksgiving;  Let’s take a moment  to relax and unwind ourselves.  Join us for the free workshop to explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice.

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

results.description:
Tonight we will be watching and discussing the third part of the four part series Inner Worlds Outer Worlds.

Tonight's topic is The Serpent and The Lotus

If you are not able to get here by 6:30 when we will begin watching the movie, you can watch it ahead of time and come for the discussion, which will begin about 7:05 pm.

You can access Part Three of the Series - The Serpent - here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yNEruEsb5T4

Summary: There is one vibratory field that connects all things. It has been called Akasha, Logos, the primordial OM, the music of the spheres, the Higgs field, dark energy, and a thousand other names throughout history. The vibratory field is at the root of all true spiritual experience and scientific investigation. It is the same field of energy that saints, Buddhas, yogis, mystics, priests, shamans and seers, have observed by looking within themselves. Many of history's monumental thinkers, such a Pythagoras, Kepler, Leonardo DaVinci, Tesla, and Einstein, have come to the threshold of this great mystery. It is the common link between all religions, all sciences, and the link between our inner worlds and our outer worlds.
results.name: Mystical Movie Night: The Serpent and the Lotus from Inner Worlds, Outer Worlds

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Friends,

Happy Thanksgiving Day. Join us this Friday November 27 @ Empire Rooftop for our Friday Night Social Mixer. This venue is conveniently located near Lincoln Center. You are guaranteed to have a fun time on this rooftop.

Get to meet a fun and diverse group of people.


Empire rooftop is one of the best rooftops in NYC!   


This event is from 6pm- 10pm.


*Later that night we will go to Monarch for the after party! (71 West 35th Street between 5th and 6th Avenue)

Dress code is business casual.


Admission is free for all members. Just mention Rory's List to the door person upon arrival.

This is a multi Meetup group event.


Contact us if you have further questions.

Don't forget to RSVP if you would like to join us.


You are always welcome to invite your family, friends and colleagues. 

We look forward in seeing you this Friday.


Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Rory

[masked]

Friday Night Social Mixer @ Empire Rooftop! Multi Meetup Groups! No Cover!

Date: Friday, November 27, 2015

Time: 6pm- 10pm

Venue: Empire Rooftop (Empire Hotel) 44 W 63RD STREET AND BROADWAY!

Admission: Mention Rory's List at the door for free entry.

Dress Code: Business Casual/Chic (No t-shirts, no tank tops, no flip flops, no sneakers. no large bags)

Subway: TAKE 1 TRAIN TO Lincoln Center, A, B, D, F, C TRAIN TO Columbus Circle.

  AFTER PARTY @ MONARCH NY! DRINKS, MUSIC & MORE! NO COVER! RORY'S LIST!

Date: Friday, November 27, 2015

Time: 10:15pm- 4am

Venue: Monarch Lounge

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Let's get together to visit the Whitney Museum and check out the Frank Stella show.


The Whitney present a career retrospective of Frank Stella (b. 1936), one of the most important living American artists. This survey will be the most comprehensive presentation of Stella’s career to date, showcasing his prolific output from the mid-1950s to the present through approximately 120 works, including paintings, reliefs, maquettes, sculptures, and drawings. Co-organized by the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth and the Whitney, this exhibition will feature Stella’s best-known works alongside rarely seen examples drawn from collections around the world. Accompanied by a scholarly publication, the exhibition will fill the Whitney's entire fifth floor, an 18,000-square-foot gallery that is the Museum’s largest space for temporary exhibitions.

Join us and let's get a drink after. It's been a while since we saw each other :)
results.name: Let's visit the Frank Stella show at the Whitney Museum

results.description:
What better way to start the season off then at Killington! We will be staying at Killington Mountain Lodge. I have included a description of the hotel below. This INCLUDES Breakfast, Lift Tickets for 2 days, and Lodging. We generally carpool, I will do what I can to help. There will be 2 people per hotel room as well. Normally we stay at the Inn of Six Mountains, it has been since sold and renovated. The rates have unfortunately gone up as well but this is still the best value on the mountain. For those that RSVP early I'm eating a bit of the cost so RSVP as soon as you can! Rates go up November 1st! 

Now on to the info! 

How are we getting there?


We will all carpool, if you know someone then carpool with them. If not, we can try and help you out. It is highly recommended to go to our happy hours so you can meet the people in the group and hopefully someone to carpool with.

Will there be snow?

Everyone asks this every year! YES! The whole mountain won't be open but they will have top to bottom riding.

What are we doing?

Snowboarding! Duh!

Are there any nighttime activities?

Of course, Killington has a very good nightlife as well as a bunch of great restaurants. We'll organize something when we're up there and if you want to join the more the merrier, if you want to wander on your own, we'll see you on the slopes!

What's included?

2 Day lift ticket, lodging, and hot breakfast buffet.

How does lodging work?

There are 2 people per room so let me know who you'd like to be roomed with. 

What if I don't have a roommate?

If you don't have someone to room with I'll match you up with someone. Generally if you're new to the group I'll match you up with someone that we know to make you more comfortable and will also match you with the same gender. 


Where are we staying?


Killington Mountain Lodge(Formerly The Inn of Six Mountains): Located on the Killington Access Road, this 3 star hotel offers unique hotel rooms with king beds,queen beds and two doubles. All hotel guests enjoy a hot breakfast buffet, shuttle service to and from ski resort, a movie room,complimentary use of computer in lobby and wireless internet in common areas, a small indoor pool and hot tubs, and the Cedar’s Restaurant and Bar. Walking distance to Moguls Sports Pub, The Wobbly Barn, The Lookout, Baja Burrito, and many more…

How much?

The price is $275 and then after November 1st the price will be raised to $295 so get in early!
