results.description:
Some years ago Sustainable Flatbush began hosting a potluck dinner on the day after Thanksgiving to celebrate Buy Nothing Day – known to most as Black Friday, the year’s biggest shopping event.

We wanted to create an alternative for those who don’t relate to the manic consumerism promoted in mainstream media, who would prefer to share a meal with old and new friends and build community.

All Souls Bethlehem Church has provided a home for our Buy Nothing Day potluck in the past, and we are happy to announce that they will continue the much-loved tradition we started here in Flatbush. Everyone is welcome, just bring some food or drink to share. Hope to see you there!

Friday November 27th, 7-10pm
All Souls Bethlehem Church
566 East 7th Street btw. Cortelyou and Ditmas (map)
(it’s a church in a house! look for the banner on the porch)

* We are also very excited to see some retailers, notably outdoor equipment supplier (and consumer-owned cooperative) REI, closing their doors on Black Friday and giving employees the day off. REI’S #optoutside campaign encourages everyone to get outdoors instead of shopping, and we plan to do just that. Check in with our Facebook page, where we’ll be inviting you to join us for a walk in the neighborhood (likely Prospect Park).
results.name: Buy Nothing Day Potluck: the tradition continues!

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them whenever and however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!


Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change 
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions 
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress 
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
Are you interested in deepening your yoga practice?
Do you want to learn a way to practice yoga when you can't do physical asana?

Then consider adding mantra and meditation to your yoga practice!

In this group practice you will learn the meditation practice outlined in "The Yoga Sutras of Pantajali", often referred to as the path of Raja Yoga. You will also learn the two most powerful mantras, the Gayatri and Maha Mrtyunjaya. The combination of mantra and meditation clears the nadis, chakras, and karmic knots which aids in the development of clarity of mind and deepens spiritual awareness.

Please join us on Friday November 27 from 7-8:30pm. No prior experience is needed. All levels are welcome from complete beginner to advanced practiioners.
If you have a copy of "The Yoga Sutras of Pantajali" with commentary by Swami Satchidananda, please bring it with you.

This class will be free through the end of the year for the holiday season and will be repeated in December (date TBD). We will be accepting monetary donations for City Harvest and winter coats for the NY Cares Coat Drive.

Nadine Boles is a yoga practitioner/teacher and Reiki Master Teacher who holds certifications in Raja Yoga, Meditation Teaching, and Gentle Yoga from the Integral Yoga Institute of NY.

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

results.description:
We look squarely into the heart of gratitude on the day of Thanksgiving. 

We slow the hectic pace of life . We prepare ritualistic meals. We gather at the harvest table. We connect with loved ones. 

And yet, how many of us are consciously practicing the art of gratitude on a daily basis? How many of us are actively seeking to find the light and joy of gratitude in every person, every relationship, every sharp edge that we meet?

In an attempt to cultivate gratitude beyond the obligatory one-day-a-year position, I would like to encourage us all to conduct "The Gratitude Experiment".


Starting today, until we meet at the end of the month on November 27th, you will be asked to hand-write a thank you note. Every. Single. Day. Your ability to benefit from this exercise is directly contingent upon your level of sacred commitment to it's practice.

This is a tangible practice. This is an art-form. Putting pen to paper is cathartic. It is an extension and an expression of your heart's energy center. So write freely and let the gratitude flow. We will share and discuss the spiritual lessons and personal transformations we experienced during our month-long trial.

The experiment aims to shift our perception from one of "I am lacking. I am unlucky. I am down," to "I am blessed. I am grateful. I am enough." 

As I love to quote Marianne Williamson, "A miracle is simply a shift in perception from fear to love." So from my heart to yours, I sincerely hope you will join me in The Gratitude Experiment. Just imagine what miracles may occur when you say "yes"!

With love,

Brianne
results.name: The Gratitude Experiment.

group.name: The White Elephant Spirituality Group - Morris County NJ

results.description:
Hi all, We’re excited to offer members of the CH & LC Concertgoers tickets to “An Americana Thanksgiving” at Carnegie Hall on Friday, November 27, at 8:00pm! 

The concert will feature a performance by The National Festival Chorus under the direction of Drs. Joshua Oppenheim and Julie Yu. They will present 6 shorter choral works by American composers like Stephen Paulus, Z. Randall Stroope, René Clausen. They will finish their set with a classic arrangement of ‘The Battle Hymn of the Republic’ which was penned in 1861 by celebrated woman's rights activist, Julia Ward Howe. 

The concert will also feature performances by Youngstown State University Wind Ensemble and Florida Gulf Coast University’s Bower School of Music & the Arts Wind Orchestra. 

**Tickets are only $7 each, a great discount (value $110 - Parquet seating)! You can purchase your ticket(s) directly on this event page. Please note: Once you have booked your tickets, they will be available for collection under your full name (the name listed under your PayPal "Buyer Information" in payment, not your Meetup name) at the box office at Carnegie Hall as early as 4pm on the day of the performance. 

Each individual is responsible for picking up his or her own tickets. Everyone from our Meetup group will be seated together. 

Remember, this is an exclusive club, we ask that you do not contact the box office at Carnegie Hall. Please contact me with any questions regarding your tickets.
results.name: An Americana Thanksgiving at Carnegie Hall

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

This week will be hosted by one of our newest members, R'el. This party is BYOB (Bring Your Own Booze). We will probably order a few pizzas so if you want something else please bring it yourself. We will use the comments section below to coordinate.

The list is tentatively capped at 15 people due to space limitations but we won't leave anyone hanging! Please remember to change your RSVP status to "No" if you can't make it, so that someone on the WaitList can go. Thanks!

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
This group meets on the 4th Friday of each month to discuss various works of "modern" masters or upcoming talent in SF, fantasy, paranormal, horror and related genres. It also occasionally explores classics and the 'masters' of the classics.

Emperor Mollusk. Intergalactic Menace. Destroyer of Worlds. Conqueror of Other Worlds. Mad Genius. Ex-Warlord of Earth. Not bad for a guy without a spine. But what's a villain to do after he's done . . . everything. With no new ambitions, he's happy to pitch in and solve the energy crisis or repel alien invaders should the need arise, but if he had his way, he'd prefer to be left alone to explore the boundaries of dangerous science. Just as a hobby, of course. Retirement isn't easy though. If the boredom doesn't get him, there's always the Venusians. Or the Saturnites. Or the Mercurials. Or . . . well, you get the idea. If that wasn't bad enough, there's also the assassins of a legendary death cult and an up-and-coming megalomaniac (as brilliant as he is bodiless) who have marked Emperor for their own nefarious purposes. But Mollusk isn't about to let the Earth slip out of his own tentacles and into the less capable clutches of another. So it's time to dust off the old death ray and come out of retirement. Except this time, he's not out to rule the world. He's out to save it from the peril of THE SINISTER BRAIN!
results.name: Modern Masters:  Emperor Mollusk vs. the Sinister Brain by A. Lee Martinez

ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
Do you need to get away from your family? Did you eat too much turkey, and feel the need to dance it off? Did you shop hard for Black Friday, and need to de-stress? Whatever your reasons, we've got you covered!

This week, we have special guest teacher Stephen York teaching our Intermediate class! The topic is called "Learning to Dance with the Blues Aesthetic." Stephen fell in love with blues dancing back in 2008 when it came to Boston. Since then, he has traveled the country learning from the best teachers he could find what makes the blues the blues, and how to dance to it. This week he's coming to New York to show you how to use your body to move from the ground up to dance musically to the blues!

And not only is Stephen going to teach the Intermediate lesson - he's going to spin for us, too! What a treat!!

Remember, the Spanish Benevolent Society at La Nacional is a non-profit organization. They enjoy having us blues dancers there, but we need your help in supporting the venue, by purchasing drinks at the bar. If each dancer who comes in buys just a soda or a bottle of water, you'll be helping contribute to Friday Night Blues continuing to have a lasting relationship with La Nacional for a long time to come!


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson w/ Shira

8:30pm-9:30pm - Intermediate Lesson w/ Stephen York

9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/ Stephen York


****************************************************************************

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (cash only). But if you pay for both at the same time, it's just $20 for the night! Discount punch cards are also available at the fornt desk.(Volunteering gets you in for free! [masked] for more info.)

Bring socks or dance shoes with slippery soles (for easy turning). It's especially important to have clean, dry shoes when it's wet outside.

There is no dress code, but hygiene is important and dressing up a bit is a nice thing to do. Prioritize comfort and ability to move!


****************************************************************************

CLASS DESCRIPTIONS:

**Please plan to arrive on time. After 15 minutes have passed, dancers are asked to wait outside the dance space until the lesson is over.

Fundamentals (8:30pm-9:30pm):

Fundamentals classes are for students new to blues dance and experienced students looking to hone their blues dance fundamentals. We cover how to connect with the music, how to connect with a partner, and have a rotating set of material to introduce students to important concepts in blues partner dance. These classes will give you everything you need to know to have a successful dance, and whet your appetite for more!


Intermediate (8:30pm-9:30pm**):

Intermediate series are technique-based classes designed to build specific knowledge and skills in students with prior blues dance experience. Intermediate classes are aimed to expand your knowledge depth in a specific topic of blues vocabulary through body awareness and historical context. Ultimately, taking class is your vehicle to having even more fun on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: https://www.facebook.com/BluesDanceNewYork/events
results.name: Friday Night Blues

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11401142_1720823001478478_3682666258495805787_n.jpg?oh=6d3a52147bbb4787f69b1b492b283ec2&oe=56D0E6E4

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.
results.name: Salsa Dancing: La Fama Mention Salsa New York for the discount !

results.description:
Is salsa dancing and learning on your bucket list? If so, then you should come to La Fama, a Salsa dancing party that takes place every Friday in Times Square. Come out, bring your friends, and leave your worries and stress at home. With admission, you can take our complimentary FREE salsa dancing class and dance all night long to great salsa tracks played by our DJ. Here are the details:

Admission: $10. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The class is free with admission. It begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic steps, how to hold your partner, how to be on time with the music, and so on. You do not need to bring a dance partner since we rotate students so you get to practice with everyone else. But do bring your friends and have a blast. After the class, dance all night with all the people you met during the class. The instructor will usually be Silvio Neris unless there is an invited instructor. Here is silvio In action:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FMy3EtfWqSY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ep-cNukVLJo

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
